sections.title: How do I calculate IDBI Personal Loan EMI?

elements.body:
There is a dedicated EMI Calculation Tool in the BankBazaar website. The tool i.e. the Personal Loan EMI Calculator, can be accessed from the homepage in the ‘Financial Tools’ sub-category at the top of the page.

On reaching the EMI calculator page, you will see two scales marked as “Loan Amount” and “Tenure”. Drag the scale to the relevant amount and loan tenure that you are looking to pay. Under the scales, there are two boxes marked “Interest Rate” and “Processing Fee”. Both are self-explanatory and the exact figures may be entered by you.

On entering the details and clicking “Calculate”, you will be taken to a new page with charts and graphs that show you the loan breakup, amortization, and repayment details in a visually attractive and easy-to-understand way.

sections.title: IDBI Personal Loan Customer Care Number

elements.body: Have a few doubts about your personal loan from IDBI Bank? You can get in touch with the bank's customer care representatives by calling on their customer care helpline number. If you are calling from India, you can use the toll-free number or the non-toll-free number of the bank. You can send a message to the bank at 9220800800 with the following text: 'IDBICARE'. You may also fill an online grievance redressal form for getting your troubles resolved. You may also send an email to the bank with your complaint details.

items.question: Am I eligible for IDBI Personal Loan?
items.answer: IDBI Personal Loan offers personal loans only for salaried individuals earning more than the minimum stipulated amount per month depending on the city of their residence. The minimum monthly income required for IDBI Personal Loan is Rs. 20,000 per month. If you fall into this group, you can definitely apply for a IDBI personal loan.

items.question: How do I repay IDBI Personal loan?
items.answer: You can repay the loan in Equated Monthly Installments (EMI's) using the ECS facility or through post-dated cheques.

items.question: What is the maximum loan one can get from IDBI?
items.answer: IDBI offers personal loans as high as Rs. 10 Lakhs for successful applicants depending on their financial record and repayment history.

items.question: What is the tenure for IDBI personal loan?
items.answer: IDBI offers personal loan with a tenure period ranging from 12 months to 60 months making it suitable for all loan seekers.

items.question: What are the reasons for which I can avail a personal loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: Personal loans from IDBI Bank can be availed for any personal reason. Most customers who avail the loan do so to meet unforeseen financial crunches or to make payments to an increasing credit card debt. Personal loans from IDBI Bank can be taken out to meet expenses related to household purchases, immediate expenses, childrens education, hospitalisation, etc. Personal loans from the bank can also be availed to fund payments of your home loan.

items.question: What are the documents I will have to furnish when applying for a personal loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: Customers will have to fill in the loan application form and submit it to the bank for approval along with proof of identity, proof of residence, form 16, latest salary slip, and bank statement for the past six months. A passport sized photograph must also be affixed to the loan application form prior to submission. For proof of identity, customers may submit any one of passport, Voters ID, driving license, Defence ID card, ration card, PAN card, Government employee ID card, or Aadhaar card. For proof of address, customers may submit any one of passport, ration card, Voters ID, registered lease / rent agreement, driving license, telephone / water / electricity bill, property tax bill, or gas bill.

items.question: How is the calculation of interest done on a personal loan?
items.answer: A predetermined rate of interest will be applied to the personal loan and interest will be charged on reducing balance method. The amount of interest will be debited to your loan account on a monthly basis. Interest rates are subject to change from time to time at the discretion of the bank.

items.question: Can anybody apply for an IDBI Bank personal loan?
items.answer: Customers of IDBI Bank are the only ones who can avail a personal loan from the bank. Salaried individuals who have a savings account with IDBI for at least three years or preferred customers who have been banking with IDBI for a minimum of one year can avail loans from the bank. There are other eligibility criteria that must be met for the bank to approve your application for a personal loan, such as your income, your job security, your credit score, etc. The bank will take into consideration these factors and others before confirming whether or not you have the ability to repay the loan and only then will it approve your application.

items.question: What are the benefits of availing a personal loan from IDBI Bank?
items.answer: There are many advantages to approaching IDBI Bank for a Personal loan. First and foremost, the rate of interest offered by the bank is attractive in comparison with its competitors. Interest is charged on reducing balance method, and the documentation process if fairly simple and quick. The bank also offers personalised services to customers and the borrower will not be levied with any insurance fees for loan insurance.

items.question: How can I make repayments towards the personal loan?
items.answer: Your personal loan from IDBI Bank can be repaid in EMIs by putting standing instructions / a mandate to debit your saving / salary account with the bank on a predetermined date each month.

sections.title: Overview of Indian Overseas Bank(IOB)

elements.body: The Indian Overseas Bank (IOB) is a public sector bank with more than 3300 branches in India, and 8 overseas branches. It is one of the foremost banks in India with low interest rates on borrowings, extensive coverage, speedy processes, and good customer support. Headquartered in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, IOB is one of the largest banks in India and has left behind a trail of happy customers throughout its decades of existence.

sections.title: About IOB (Indian Overseas Bank) Personal Loan

elements.body:
IOB provides Personal Loans for customers who show a steady source of income. These include employees of PSUs, government, reputed private firms, and other companies. The customer has to be in active service at the time of requesting loans.

IOB personal loans are available under two segments:

  • IOB Clean Loan:This is available for salaried professionals working in reputed or other institutions in India. The maximum loaned amount is ? 15 lakhs.
  • IOB Sahayika Loan:This personal loan available for self-employed people and can be used for social financial requirements such as marriages, medical treatments, or children’s education. The maximum amount that can be borrowed is ? 10 lakhs.

sections.title: Why Choose IOB Personal Loan?

elements.body:
IOB is a reputed public sector bank with operations throughout the country. It has received a lot of awards through the years such as “Banking Excellence Award” from the Finance Ministry of Government of India (GOI), National award for MSME lending excellence, Bankers’ Excellence Award from Rotary International - United States of America, among many others.

3/4th of total stakes in IOB is owned by GOI, while remaining stakes are owned by the public. As such, there’s the added benefit of banking with a government-owned enterprise, which increases reliability and trust on the part of the borrower. Also, IOB Personal Loan interest rates are very competitive and the registration and other fees are low compared to other banks.

sections.title: Features of IOB Personal Loan

elements.body:
• Clean Loan

This loan can be used for any purpose encompassing social or financial commitment. Loan amounts are decided by the salary received. Highest loan amount is ? 15 lakhs or 10 times salary, whichever is lower. This amount is only applicable if the salary is directly remitted or directed through the respective loan issuing branch.

For all other cases, a maximum of 5 times the monthly salary or ? 1 lakh, whichever is lower, is provided as loan.

LIC agents can avail loans up to 10 times their average calculated monthly commission, or ? 10 lakh, whichever is lower.

As security, 2 third party guarantors are needed, with each having salary equal to or more than the borrower’s gross takeaway.

  • Sahayika Loan

This loan is available for commitments such as marriages, education, holidays and other commitments under law. The bank doesn’t verify declared purposes.

The maximum amount that can be borrowed is ? 10 lakhs. This amount though is dependent on the actual value of the offered security, as well as the borrower’s capacity to repay the loan. Business people, self-employed, or other professionals stand to borrow the income amount from last year, or ? 10 lakhs, whichever is lower.

As security, loan takers have to provide liquid securities or immovable property including UNITS, ULIP, KVP, IVP, NSC, LIC policies, and other similar items. The available margin is 10% on policies bought from LIC and other private life insurers, 25% for liquid securities as mentioned above, and 50% on immovable property.

The maximum repayment period of both the loan types discussed above is 60 months, while the minimum duration is 12 months.

sections.title: What are the interest rates on IOB personal loan?

elements.body:
To allow customers to take care of any social or financial commitment, Indian Overseas Bank provides the IOB Clean Loan and the IOB Sahayika Loan. Both of these personal loans are accompanied by several beneficial features and can be availed at attractive rates of interest. The interest rates offered for the IOB Clean Loan are set on the basis of MCLR i.e. Marginal Cost of funds based Lending Rate. MCLR consists of 4 components " Tenor premium, marginal cost of funds and operating costs and negative carry on account of cash reserve ratio (CRR).

Indian Overseas Bank MCLR (Marginal Cost of funds based Lending Rate) (For new borrowers)

Following the guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of India, IOB will offer personal loans based on MCLR based interest rate, effective from April 1, 2016.

sections.title: IOB Personal Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
• For Clean Loan

Employees of PSUs, government, reputed private firms, and other companies presently in service. The final take home pay, once loan instalment deductions are carried out, shouldn’t be less than 50% of the gross pay. Life Insurance Corporation of India agents can also apply for this loan under conditions.

Employees must have an active savings bank account with IOB in the loan issuing branch; Salaries should also be directed through the savings bank account of the loan issuing branch; A letter from the employer undertaking deduction of instalment from salary every month till the loan tenure is active; and another letter from the employer undertaking dues recovery through employee’s terminal benefits in case of resignation, retirement, or death.

  • For Sahayika Loan

Self-employed individuals with at least 3 years of continued operations, or permanent employees of reputed companies can apply for this loan. The final take home shouldn’t be less than 40% of gross pay after instalment deductions have been made.

sections.title: How do I calculate IOB personal loan EMI?

elements.body:
Calculating the Equated Monthly Instalment, or EMI, is a very simple task with BankBazaar’s dedicated Personal Loan EMI Calculator tool. The calculator can be accessed by following the steps given below:

  • Go to Financial Tools > Personal Loan EMI Calculator.
  • Users have to next select the respective “Loan Amount” and “Tenure” on a scale by selecting their choices. The maximum loan amount that can be calculated is 30 lakhs, and the tenure has a cap of 5 years.
  • The next box, marked as “Fee”, will ask users to enter the relevant interest rate % that they are going to pay. Default interest rates will already be filled, so users just have to change the figure provided in the Fee field.
  • Once all the details have been filled, clicking the “Calculate” button will take users to a list of comprehensive information regarding the IOB Personal Loan such as monthly EMI, total due interest, as well as amortization details (monthly/yearly), for their reference.

All the information displayed at the end of the process allow users to plan their loan repayments with ease and according to hard data.

items.question: Am I eligible for IOB Personal Loan?
items.answer: IOB Personal Loan offers personal loans only for salaried individuals earning more than the minimum stipulated amount per month depending on the city of their residence. The minimum monthly income required for IOB Personal Loan is more than 50% of the gross pay. If you fall into this group, you can definitely apply for a IOB personal loan.

items.question: How do I repay IOB Personal loan?
items.answer: You can repay the loan in Equated Monthly Installments (EMI's) using the ECS facility or through post-dated cheques.

items.question: What is the maximum loan one can get from IOB?
items.answer: IOB offers personal loans as high as Rs. 15 Lakhs for successful applicants depending on their financial record and repayment history.

items.question: What is the tenure for IOB personal loan?
items.answer: IOB offers personal loan with a tenure period ranging upto 60 months making it suitable for all loan seekers.

items.question: How does the bank determine my eligibility for a personal loan?
items.answer: Customers who are interested in applying for a personal loan with Indian Overseas Bank will have to fill in and submit the loan application form along with the required set of documents which will be assessed by the bank to determine your eligibility for a personal loan. The documents you will have to furnish include proof of residence, proof of income, and your credit report. After a thorough analysis of your credit history, the bank will check if you earn the income required to make EMI payments on time, and if you meet all the eligibility criteria laid down by the bank, you will receive the loan amount as soon as possible.

items.question: How much money can I borrow through a personal loan from Indian Overseas Bank?
items.answer: The amount of money you can borrow through a Personal loan from Indian Overseas Bank will depend on your ability to repay. The bank will not grant you an amount in excess of 40% of your monthly income so that EMI payments can be made on time. Self-employed individuals will have to show proof of profit to confirm that they can make repayments without any delays. Other factors that play a part in determining how much money the bank will offer you include your credit history, your job security, the company with which you are employed, and your residential location.

items.question: What interest rates can I expect when taking a personal loan from Indian Overseas Bank?
items.answer: The interest rate applicable to each loan will depend upon the customer and his / her credit history, job security, monthly income and a few other factors that the bank takes into consideration. Usually the interest rates range between 12% and 28%.

items.question: Do my chances of availing a personal loan increase if I have a co-applicant?
items.answer: Customers who do not meet all eligibility criteria or those who have a poor credit history can opt for co-applicants as it not only increases their chances of availing a loan, but also exposes them to higher loan amounts and lower interest rates.

items.question: Can I prepay my personal loan, and if so, what are the prepayment charges that will be applicable?
items.answer: Since loans are granted with the guarantee from the customer that it will be repaid within a predetermined time frame, customers who wish to clear their debt sooner have the option to do so, but will have to face a prepayment penalty fee in this case. The fee is usually around 5% of the outstanding loan amount but may be different for different customers depending upon their credit history.

elements.body:
Kotak Mahindra Bank has acquired ING Vysya to emerge as the 4th largest private sector bank in India. Henceforth, all the banking facilities owned by the erstwhile ING Vysya Bank will be an integral part of Kotak Mahindra, and the new combined entity will be known as the Kotak Mahindra Bank.

ING Vysya Bank is a privately owned Indian multinational bank based in Bangalore, with retail, wholesale, and private banking platforms formed from the 2002 purchase of an equity stake in Vysya Bank by the Dutch ING Group. As of March 2013, ING Vysya is the 17th largest private sector bank in India with assets total Rs. 54836 crore and operating a pan-India network of over 1,000 outlets, including 527 branches, which service over two million customers. ING Group, the highest-ranking institutional shareholder, currently holds a 44% equity stake in ING Vysya Bank. INY Vysya Bank offer loan like Home Loan, Personal Loan, Gold Loan, Loan against Property, Loan against Security. Personal Loan in INY Vysya Bank has key benefits like easy documentation, Speedy loan processing, No security.

sections.title: About ING Vysya (Kotak Mahindra) Bank Personal Loan

elements.body:
In April 2015, ING Vysya merged into Kotak Mahindra after which the bank is known by the name of Kotak. All bank papers, cheque books, passbooks etc. are also now in the name of Kotak Mahindra. The combined entity has now come into existence while the complete merger of operations and integration of staff will happen over the next few months.

ING Vysya was a private sector bank that was founded in the year 2002 as a merger between the ING group of Denmark and the local Vysya Bank from India. The bank has a huge customer base of over 2 million. ING Vysya bank got listed at the National Stock Exchange as well as the Bombay Stock Exchange. The bank ranked among the top 5 private banks of India in terms of the most trusted entity to bank with.

ING on the other hand, is a Dutch banking institution which has global financial expertise in the products and services that it offers. ING Vysya, now Kotak Mahindra, offers financial capabilities in the domain of private banking, corporate banking and wholesale banking.

Why choose Kotak Mahindra Personal Loan?

Personal loans from Kotak Mahindra are one of the easiest to avail and flexible monetary options for urgent financial needs. These financial requirements can be of any nature, be it a wedding in the family. An urgent medical expense or children's education. Kotak Mahindra offers personal finance for a host of personal needs. Here are some of the most prominent reasons why Kotak Mahindra personal loans are highly popular among customers.

Flexible and high personal loan amount: Customers can avail loan amounts from a mere Rs.50,000 to Rs.15,00,000 through Kotak Mahindra personal loans. These are on-demand loans and furnish loan amounts as per customers' personal loan requests.

Attractive Rate of Interest: Interest rates charged on Kotak Mahindra personal loans are quite attractive as well as competitive. These rates are dependent upon a variety of variables like the type of collateral provided to bank, track record of the personal loan applicant, and amount of finance required and the annual income of the applicant.

Easy Repayments: Various modes of repayment can be availed for paying off the Kotak Mahindra personal loan. This can be done via online banking or by visiting any of the bank branches. Also, standing instructions can be set which allows bank to auto-debit the installment amount each month from your account.

Features of Kotak Mahindra Personal Loan

Be it a long-pending family vacation or an urgent medical expense, Kotak Mahindra personal loans are the best financial instrument to help you sail smoothly through all the financial turbulence that you may face. Here are some of the most prominent features of personal loans by Kotak Mahindra bank.

Quick Loan Processing: Rapid turn-around time is one of the most striking features of personal loans from Kotak Mahindra. Also, quick loan approval and bank doorstep service to get assistance on all aspects of personal loans is one ideal feature in today's fast paced world where customers struggle to reach bank during working hours.

Flexible Tenure: The loan repayment period is flexible and personal loans can be repaid in a maximum of 5 years. The personal loan tenure ranges between 12 months and 60 months. The EMI date is subject to the loan disbursal date of your Kotak Mahindra personal loan.

Document's required: Here is a list of documents that you need to be ready with if you are planning to avail a personal loan from Kotak Mahindra –

  • Complete Loan Application form
  • Any Identity proof out of Voter's Card/ Passport/Aadhar Card/Photo Ration Card or any other ID proof
  • Proof of Residence like Gas bill, Passport etc.
  • Proof of Age - Driving License, Birth Certificate, PAN Card
  • Signature proof, PAN card, driving license, passport
  • Last 3 months salary slips and Form 16
  • Last 6 months bank account statements

  • Net monthly income should be at least Rs.25,000 for applicants

sections.title: How to calculate EMI for Kotak Mahindra Bank Personal Loans

elements.body:
Online personal loan EMI calculators are one of the most popular tools to know your personal loan EMI even before you have actually availed your loan. These online tools take as input your personal loan amount, the applicable interest rate, the corresponding processing fee and the loan tenure and process these inputs to yield the monthly installment schedule that you will be required to stick to in order to repay your personal loan with Kotak Mahindra bank.

The best thing about these calculators is that they help in financial planning of an individual and also in helping customers decide which bank to choose for availing personal loan. Since, interest rates and processing charges may vary with different banks hence, it becomes easier for people to compare two or more lending entities when the subsequent change reflects in the EMI of different banks.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount for Kotak Mahindra personal loans?
items.answer: The maximum amount that can be availed as personal loan by customers is Rs.15 lakhs. The maximum loan amount is however, dependent upon various other factors like annual income, job type and age too.

items.answer: The application form can be availed by visiting any of the Kotak Mahindra branch or by visiting the bank's website.

items.question: Can I manage my personal loan account online?
items.answer: Yes. Kotak Mahindra personal loan account can be handled online. You can also choose to receive your loan statement online on the email id registered with the company.

items.question: What are the pre-closure charges for Kotak Mahindra Personal loan?
items.answer: Pre-closure charges are 5% of the outstanding loan amount.

items.question: Is there a processing fee for getting Kotak Mahindra personal loan sanctioned?
items.answer: A processing fee equal to 2% of the disbursed loan amount is applicable. In addition to this a service tax too is levied.

items.answer: Yes. BankBazaar provides real-time tracking facility of loan applications, through SMS as well as e-mails.

items.question: Does Kotak Mahindra charge a late payment fee for loan repayments?

items.answer: Yes. BankBazaar.com ensures high level of security via data encryption. The website is committed to not sharing your personal information with any third-party agents.

sections.title: About Karnataka Bank Personal Loan:

elements.body: A personal loan can be a real life-saver during a financial crisis. Besides, it helps you to fulfill your various dreams. With Karnataka Bank, you can enjoy personal banking, professional banking, online trading, online shopping and a lot more services. It is one of the major private banks in Karnataka, located at Mangalore. The bank has a national presence with a network of almost 628 branches spread across to 21 states and two union territories in India. Karnataka Bank is ranked as “A Class Scheduled Commercial Bank” for the quality service it provides to its clients. The bank has been operative in India over 88 years. Like all other banks in India, Karnataka Bank also understands the importance of Personal Loan in your life, and hence offers personal finance for various purposes.

sections.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Features:

elements.body:
Both salaried and self-employed individuals can apply for Karnataka Bank personal loan. The bank offers two types of personal loans:

KBL Salaried Persons Loan which is a scheme to finance salaried individuals

K-POWER which is a personal loan scheme to finance both salaried and self-employed individuals.

Karnataka Bank personal loan comes with a lot of attractive features which include:

  • Both salaried and non-salaried employees can avail Karnataka Bank personal loan.
  • Best quality customer service with 24/7 customer support available.
  • You can apply online.
  • You can get loan amounts varying up to Rs. 5 lakhs.
  • ATM withdrawal of funds held in the personal loan account is available.
  • KBL Salaried Persons Loan can be availed for up to 5 years.
  • With K-POWER, you can draw up to Rs.25,000.
  • Karnataka Bank offers floating rate of interest for personal loans.
  • The bank charges 0.50% processing fee for personal loans subject to a minimum of Rs. 250.
  • You can avail K-POWER for 12 months. Also it is subject to renewal.
  • You need to provide security for KBL Salaried Persons Loan.

items.title: Why Choose Karnataka Bank Personal Loan?
items.body: Choosing Karnataka Bank’s personal loan can help you to fulfill your various requirements. The bank offers low interest rate and charges minimum processing fee. You can use this loan amount to perform various tasks such as buying household objects, educational needs of children, wedding, medical expense of self and dependents, house repairing etc.

items.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Interest Rate:
items.body:
Karnataka Bank Personal Loan MCLR and ROI

All the loans which are sanctioned post April 2017 has to follow the new lending rate system – MCLR (Marginal Cost Based Lending Rate). This is a tenure based benchmark. Existing Karnataka Bank Personal Loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations.

The current interest rate based on MCLR = 10.25% p.a.

Karnataka Bank follows the following MCLR rates:

TenureMLCR Percentage
Overnight8.40%
1 month8.45%
3 months8.55%
6 months8.70%
1 year8.90%

Note: All rates mentioned above are applicable as of April, 2017. Karnataka Bank can change these rates at its own discretion. Borrowers are advised to check prevailing rates while applying for a loan.

Check more details about Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Interest rates

items.title: Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Eligibility:
items.body:
Salaried, professionals and any individual earning regular income from pension, rent etc. are eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan. The eligibility conditions for KBL Salaried Persons Loan include:

  • You need to be a permanent employee of listed companies, colleges, schools, and universities.
  • Your maximum age should not be more than 55 years.
  • Your minimum age should be 21 years.
  • You should have minimum 3 years’ service period left from the time of taking the loan.

The eligibility criteria for K-POWER includes:

  • Any person with SB or CA is eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan
  • Salaried individual, professional and any individual receiving income from rent, pension any other sources can apply for this loan.

Know more about Karnataka Bank Personal Loan Eligibility for taking Personal loan

items.title: How to calculate EMI for Karnataka Bank Personal Loan?
items.body:
Not only you can apply for Karnataka Bank Personal Loan at BankBazaar, but you can also Calculate your Personal Loan EMIs at BankBazaar. The company has a perfect tool by using which you can get your exact monthly EMI rates. It is simple and faster. In order to know your monthly EMI rates, you need to put a few things in the tool:

  • The amount you are going to take.
  • The tenure of your personal loan.
  • Processing fee (if there is any).
  • The rate of interest applicable for that particular loan.

The moment, you put this information in the EMI calculator tool of BankBazaar, the calculator will immediately calculate the amount and display it on the page. Once you know your monthly EMIs for your personal loan, it becomes easier for you to plan your budget as well as other financial goals.

items.question: What are the benefits of opting for a personal loan?
items.answer: A personal loan comes with many added benefits. In fact, such a loan can help you fulfill all your dreams and aspirations. You can use the amount received as personal loan for various requirements such as home renovation/repairing, education, wedding, travel and many more purposes based on your requirements. A personal loan can act as a real savior at the time of financial shortage.

items.question: How do I know if I am eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan or not?
items.answer: Both salaried and self-employed individuals are eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan. However, KBL Salaried Persons Loan can be availed by only salaried individuals while K-POWER can be availed by salaried people, professional and self-employed having income from various sources like rent, pension etc.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount I am eligible for, if I am a salaried employee?
items.answer: You can get up to Rs.5 lakhs as personal loan from Karnataka Bank, if you are a salaried employee of a listed company, college, school or university.

items.question: Am I eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan, if I am a non-salaried individual?
items.answer: Yes, you are eligible for K-POWER, a personal loan scheme offered by Karnataka Bank for non-salaried individuals. However, a salaried individual is also eligible to take this loan.

items.question: What are the purposes for which Karnataka Bank offers personal loan?
items.answer: Karnataka Bank offers personal loan for a variety of requirements that you may have. You can use your Karnataka Bank personal loan amount to accomplish tasks such as children’s education, wedding planning, home repairing etc.

items.question: How much processing fee does Karnataka Bank charge for personal loan?
items.answer: Karnataka Bank charges a nominal amount as processing fee. It charges 0.50% processing fee for personal loans.

items.question: What is the rate of interest for Karnataka Bank personal loan?
items.answer: The rate of interest for Karnataka Bank personal loan scheme is base rate+6.50% . For consumer durable personal loans, interest rate is base rate + 5.00%. The current base rate offered by Karnataka bank is 10.75% per annum, effective form 10.11.2012.

items.question: How can I check my Karnataka Bank personal loan status?
items.answer: You can check your personal loan status by contacting the relevant official at the bank.

items.question: Can I withdraw my Karnataka Bank personal loan amount through an ATM?
items.answer: Yes, you can withdraw your personal loan amount offered by Karnataka Bank via an ATM.

items.question: Can I download my Karnataka Bank personal loan statement online?
items.answer: Loan statements can be requested for by contacting the bank.

items.question: What is a K-POWER personal loan available at Karnataka Bank?
items.answer: K-POWER personal loan from Karnataka Bank which is available to both salaried and self-employed individuals.

items.question: How much can one draw from the K-POWER personal loan from Karnataka Bank?
items.answer: An individual who has availed the loans can draw Rs. 25,000 from the K-POWER personal loan.

items.question: What is the tenure of payment for K-Power personal loan?
items.answer: The person can take 12 months for payment of the loaned amount but has to renew the scheme if they wish to continue any longer.

items.question: Do I have the option to withdraw money from my Karnataka Bank personal loan from an ATM?
items.answer: Yes, it is possible to withdraw your personal loan amount through an ATM.

items.question: How much does Karnataka Bank charge as processing fees for the personal loans?
items.answer: Karnataka Bank charges only 0.5% as the processing fees for their personal loans.

items.question: How is the interest rate calculated for the Karnataka Bank personal loan?
items.answer: The rate of interest for Karnataka Bank Personal loan scheme is base rate+6.50%. For consumer durable personal loans, interest rate is base rate + 5.00%. The current base rate offered by Karnataka bank is 10.75% per annum, effective form 10.11.2012.

items.question: What are the advantages of taking a personal loan from Karnataka Bank?
items.answer: This personal loan comes with many added advantages. In fact, such a loan can help you fulfill all your dreams and aspirations. You can use the amount received as personal loan for various requirements such as home renovation/repairing, education, wedding, travel and many more purposes based on your requirements. A personal loan can act as a real saviour at the time of financial shortage.

items.question: What is the eligibility criteria for Karnataka Bank personal loans?
items.answer: Both salaried and self-employed individuals are eligible for Karnataka Bank personal loan. However, KBL Salaried Persons Loan can be availed by only salaried individuals while K-POWER can be availed by salaried people, professional and self-employed having income from various sources like rent, pension etc.

sections.title: Why Should You Choose SBI Personal Loan?

elements.body:
Customers of SBI personal loans can benefit from the following:

  • Quick disbursal of the loan amount, i.e., within 2-7 days.
  • Minimal preclosure charges for most personal loan products.
  • No administrative charges or any other kind of hidden costs.
  • Minimal documentation for application.
  • Most affordable interest rates in the market.
  • Convenient modes of repayment such as check-off facility, post-dated cheques, or cash.

State Bank of India is a leading public sector lender that offers three types of personal loans –

  • Xpress Credit Personal Loan
  • Xpress Power Loan
  • SBI Pension Loan

sections.title: SBI Personal Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
The eligibility criteria that prospective borrowers will have to meet to avail a personal loan from State Bank of India are as follows:

Eligibility for Xpress Credit Personal Loan

  • The loan applicant's minimum net monthly income (NMI) should be Rs.5,000.
  • The EMI/NMI Ratio should not be above 50%.
  • The applicant should be an employee at any of the following organizations:
  • Central and state governments
  • Central and state PSUs
  • Educational institutions with a national reputation
  • Quasi-government
  • Certain corporates that have an exclusive business relationship with SBI
  • Companies that do not have any business relationship with SBI OR any Emigration Check Required (ECR), subject to specific terms and conditions.

Eligibility for SBI Pension Loan

  • You will need to be a central or state government pensioner, defence pensioner or a family pensioner to apply for this loan scheme offered by SBI. A family pensioner is the spouse of a pensioner who is allowed to obtain pension when the pensioner dies.
  • The pensioner, as well as, the family pensioner's age should not be above 76 years.
  • For pensioners whose pension is disbursed by government treasuries, the concerned pensioner will need to give a mandate to the treasury to make the pension payment to the particular bank branch. This certain undertaking cannot be rescinded at any point in time. The treasury will also write a note that it will not agree to take any request from any pensioner to make changes to the pension payment to any other branch or bank.
  • A defence pensioner can be any pensioner of the armed forces. The armed forces include Paramilitary Forces, Army, Rashtriya Rifles, Air Force, Navy, Coast Guards, and Assam Rifles. The pension payment order will need to be with SBI.
  • The EMI (Equated Monthly Instalments) or NMP (Net Monthly Pension) should not be above 50% for every pensioner. For family pensioners, the EMI or NMP should not be above 33%.

Eligibility for SBI Xpress Power

  • The prospective borrower will need to earn a minimum monthly income of Rs.50,000

Applicants who are employed with the following entities are eligible to apply for this loan:

  • Central or state governments
  • Defence establishments
  • PSUs
  • Quasi-government bodies
  • Educational institutions that have a national reputation
  • Select corporates

sections.title: How the EMI calculation works for SBI personal loans?

elements.body:
Consider a scenario where a person earning Rs.40,000 per month takes a personal loan of Rs.1 lakh under the SBI Xpress Credit personal loan scheme. The bank charges an interest rate of 12.05% p.a. and a processing fee of 1% on the loan amount. For a loan repayment tenure of 6 months, he must pay an EMI amount of Rs.17,257 every month. His loan repayment schedule is given as follows: 

MonthPrincipalInterest amountTotal EMI paymentBalancePercentage of loan paid to date
AprRs.16,253Rs.1,004Rs.17,257Rs.83,74716.25%
MayRs.16,416Rs.841Rs.17,257Rs.67,33132.67%
JunRs.16,581Rs.676Rs.17,257Rs.50,74949.25%
JulRs.16,748Rs.510Rs.17,257Rs.34,00266.00%
AugRs.16,916Rs.341Rs.17,257Rs.17,08682.91%
SepRs.17,086Rs.172Rs.17,257Rs.0100.00%

How SBI compares with other lenders? 

Fees and charges SBI Personal Loan Bank of Baroda Personal Loan Bank of India Personal Loan Citibank Personal Loan 
Interest rate10.50% p.a. onwards11.35% p.a. onwards12.90% p.a. onwards10.99% p.a. onwards
Processing fee1% + GST2% + GST2% + GST0.25% to 3.00% + GST
Foreclosure charges3% of the outstanding loan amountN/AN/ANil
Late payment fee2% of the overdue amount2% of the overdue amountContact the bank for detailsContact the bank for details

Given that State Bank of India offers three personal loans as part of its suite of offerings, prospective borrowers can evaluate their needs and opt for a suitable type of loan.

Other loan schemes for NRI from SBI

  • NRI's can go for this loan scheme from SBI to meet any of their needs such as buying a house or meeting immediate financial needs. The bank will not be repatriating your loan amount abroad.
  • This SBI loan will be handed over solely to the depositor.
  • You can procure this loan in foreign currency or Indian Rupee by pledging a security of your NRE or FCNR or NRO deposit.
  • You can choose a demand loan, an overdraft, or a foreign currency loan.
  • The loan period for this loan is up to the outstanding maturity period.
  • The margin for this loan scheme is 10% which includes accrued interest as well principal.

SBI online overdraft (OD) against your NRI deposit

For SBI online OD, you will not have to come down to India to complete the application process in India. You can utilise the bank's internet banking platform to apply for the loan facility.

Eligibility criteriaAny customer with an NRE or NRO fixed deposit
Minimum residual period6 months
Permissible limit
  • TDR or eTDR: 75% of the face value of the deposit
  • STDR or eSTDR: 90% of the face value of the deposit
Minimum loan amountRs.25,000
Maximum loan amountRs.5 crore
Cut-off timeOnline application for overdraft facility will be open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. IST
Interest rate1% above the interest payable on the fixed deposit
Loan tenure for TDR or eTDR3 years or the outstanding maturity period of fixed deposit, whichever is lower.
Loan tenure for STDR or eSTDR5 years or the outstanding maturity period of fixed deposit, whichever is lower.
  • In the above-mentioned table, the NRE or NRO fixed deposit in the eligibility criteria includes Special term deposit (STDR) or eSTDR or Term Deposit Receipt (TDR) or eTDR in a single name holder only.
  • In the above-mentioned table, the permissible limit section refers to the overdraft limit against deposits. You will not be able to make any modifications to the overdraft limit.
  • This loan scheme is not given to joint holders of deposits.
  • The loan will be provided to you with the help of internet banking. If you want to withdraw or shift the fund, you can do it via cheque or online banking.
  • If you want to close the SBI NRI overdraft account, you will have to visit any of the branches in India. This overdraft account closure cannot be done online as of now.

Know before getting a Loan

  • How to choose Personal Loan Tenure Wisely
  • A Comprehensive Checklist for First-time Applicants of Personal Loans
  • How to deal Credit Card Debt using Personal Loans

items.question: How to check SBI personal loan status?
items.answer: You can track your SBI personal loan status by contacting customer care or visiting the nearest branch.

items.question: How to contact SBI personal loan customer care?
items.answer:
You can contact SBI personal loan customer care number through the following ways: 

  • Call the 24x7 toll-free helpline numbers which are 1800 425 3800 and 1800 11 2211. 
  • You can also call the number 080-26599990 which is chargeable. 
1800 11 2211

items.question: What are the different types of SBI personal loans offered to employees of corporates?
items.answer: Employees of corporates can apply for the Xpress Power Loan or the Xpress Credit Personal Loan, provided they meet the eligibility criteria. Keep in mind that you will need to have a salary account with the lender to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan.

items.question: If I take a personal loan from SBI, when will my liability to the bank come to an end?
items.answer: Once the entire outstanding loan amount becomes zero, your liability for your SBI personal loan will be removed.

items.question: What are the options to repay my SBI Personal loan?
items.answer: You can repay your SBI Personal Loan via EMIs through the ECS facility or through Standing Instruction.

items.question: Can I prepay my SBI Personal Loan and will I need to pay any additional charge on the prepayment of this loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay your SBI Personal Loan. The bank charges prepayment penalty for certain personal loan schemes. You can find out more about this charge when you apply for the loan.

items.question: What are the personal loan products offered by SBI?
items.answer: The 3 main types of SBI personal loan products include: SBI Xpress Power, SBI Xpress Credit Personal Loan, and SBI Pension Loan

items.question: What is the minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners?
items.answer: The minimum loan amount for SBI loan for central and state government pensioners is Rs.25,000.

items.question: How can a personal loan borrower get in touch with SBI if he or she has any queries?
items.answer: A personal loan borrower can reach out to SBI for support by making use of any of the customer care number or email addresses. The customer can also write an email to the grievance cell of SBI or visit any SBI branch for assistance.

items.question: Could you tell me the general loan tenure for SBI personal loans?
items.answer: All SBI personal loans are typically provided for a period of up to 60 months.

items.question: What should be my income to secure a personal loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: SBI offers personal loans to individuals with incomes as low as Rs.5,000. However, this amount might vary depending on the scheme applied for.

items.question: Do I need to have a guarantor to apply for the Xpress Credit Personal Loan from State Bank of India?
items.answer: No, the lender does not require you to have a guarantor. However, before applying for the loan, you should ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria specified by the lender.

sections.title: How does the EMI calculation for Syndicate Bank personal loan work?

elements.body:
Let's say that Mr. Vishwas, a marketing professional, who draws a monthly salary of Rs.45,000, avails a personal loan from Syndicate Bank. The amount borrowed by Mr. Vishwas is Rs.1.5 lakh and the tenure of the loan is one year. The interest rate applicable to the loan is 13.55% p.a., and Syndicate Bank levies a processing fee at 0.50% of the loan amount. In this case, here's what Mr. Vishwas' repayment schedule will look like:

As you can see from the above amortisation table, Mr. Vishwas will be paying Rs.13,346?as his EMIs until March 2020. The total amount he will be paying is Rs.1,61,986 (loan amount of Rs.1.5 lakh, processing fees of Rs.750, and total interest payments of Rs.11,236).

faq.title: FAQs on Syndicate Bank Personal Loan

items.question: Are there any special discounts for women borrowers who apply for a Syndicate Bank personal loan?
items.answer: Yes, women borrowers can make the most of a 0.25% on the SyndSaral personal loan scheme.

items.question: Do I have to provide any guarantee or surety when taking the SyndSaral loan from Syndicate Bank?
items.answer: Syndicate Bank accepts surety in the form of a third party and spouses having independent income in addition to adequate net worth.

items.question: Is there a penal interest on the SyndSenior loan scheme?
items.answer: Yes, 2% above the applicable interest rate will be charged on the overdue portion as penal interest.

items.question: What is the repayment tenure for the SyndSenior loan scheme?
items.answer: Customers who avail the SyndSenior loan scheme will have to repay it in a maximum of 72 EMIs.

items.question: What is the repayment tenure for the SyndSwarna scheme?
items.answer: The maximum repayment tenure for the SyndSwarna scheme is 36 months.

elements.body: UCO Bank, formerly United Commercial Bank, established in 1943 in Kolkata, is one of the oldest and major commercial banks of India. Being a Commercial Bank, giving Loans and Advances is among their primary activities. Apart from their participation in meeting both Term Loan and Working Capital requirements of Agriculture sector, Trade and Service sector, Large/Medium and Small Scale Industries sector, Infrastructure sector etc. including taking care of their Export/Import and non-fund based needs like Letter of Credit, Bank Guarantee etc., UCO Bank have a fairly large basket of loan products specially designed to suit your personal needs.UCO Personal Loan provides you To extend financial assistance to certain segment to meet unforeseen domestic expenses like marriage, education, social obligation etc. To know more, follow some simple steps given below to get attractive deals.

sections.title: Documentation needed to apply for an UCO Bank Personal Loan

elements.body:
1. Signed application form with photograph
  2. Copy of passport/voter ID card/driving license

sections.title: About UCO Bank Personal Loan

elements.body:
Being one of the major and oldest banks of the country, UCO Bank or United Commercial Bank as it was formerly known. Apart from being a commercial bank providing loans and advances among their primary activities, meeting term loans and working capital required by all sectors from agricultural, large/medium and small sectors, to infrastructure, trade and service sectors. UCO Bank has a variety of loans specially design to suit your needs.

One of them is the UCO Bank Personal Loans or UCO Bank Cash as they refer to it, this loan can be taken up by an individual who requires a Personal Loan for fulfilling the needs and requirements of him and his family, like education, marriage, medical treatments etc.

sections.title: Why choose UCO Bank Personal Loan?

elements.body:
With our current financial situation in the Indian markets, the amount we save in fixed deposits, saving accounts etc., may not have the same value in the future. Having your liquid money locked up in investments restricts your ability to have enough to pay off or spend on things you need like paying off credit card bills, taking that much needed family vacation, remodelling of your home etc.

With the UCO Bank Personal Loan or UCO Bank Cash as it's known all this is possible. UCO Bank, offers you a personal loan without collateral security for an amount of up to Rs. 2 Lacs, and for loans above that will need to put up collateral for only 40% of the loan amount.

items.title: Features of UCO Bank Personal Loan
items.body:
Some of the key features of the UCO Bank Personal Loan or UCO Bank Cash is below:

  • The maximum loan amount is Rs. 10,00, 000
  • No collateral is required for a loan of up to Rs. 2, 00, 000
  • Women have a concessional rate of interest
  • Processing charges are just 1 % amounting to a minimum of Rs. 750/-

items.title: UCO Bank Personal Loan Interest Rate
items.body:
UCO Bank offers a host of personal loan schemes to eligible borrowers, with the interest varying according to the scheme. Benchmarks adopted by the bank help in computing this interest, with two benchmarks currently in use. While interest rates computed according to base rates have been used for a while, MCLR benchmarks were introduced recently, following RBI directives.

UCO Bank Marginal Cost of Funds Based Lending Rate (MCLR) (For new borrowers)

UCO Bank introduced MCLR based benchmarks following RBI directives, with these benchmarks offering a better picture of current financial conditions. Factors like CRR, repo rate, loan tenure, operating costs, etc. have a direct correlation with MCLR, with any change in these parameters having an impact on rates payable by a borrower. The table below highlights the rates applicable as of June 2016.

MCLR Benchmark Tenure (Period)Benchmark Rates (MCLR)
Overnight8.10%
1 month8.20%
3 months8.30%
6 months8.55%
1 year8.65%
2 years9.65%

Personal loan interest rates (MCLR)

As per RBI guidelines, all consumers who avail a loan after April 1, 2016 will automatically fall under the ambit of MCLR. UCO Bank can choose to add a certain spread over and above this benchmark, with the final interest generally varying from case to case. The loan amount, repayment tenure, repayment mode (salary account with/without check-off), borrower income, etc. can all play a role in computing the final interest rate.

UCO Bank Base and Prime Lending Rates (For existing borrowers)

The base and prime lending rates at UCO Bank are highlighted below.

Base Rate9.70% per annum, effective October 5, 2015
Prime Lending Rate14.25% per annum, effective October 5, 2015

UCO Bank personal loan interest rate (Base Rate)

The date of loan approval plays a key role in determining the benchmark one falls under, with all borrowers who availed a loan before MCLR benchmarks were introduced having an option to choose their interest mode. They can either continue paying interest determined by factoring the base rate or move to MCLR. Those who refrain from migrating will pay an interest according to the loan scheme, with rates typically ranging between 12% per annum and 16% per annum. This is computed by adding a spread over the base rate, with it possible for one to avail preferential rates based on their relationship with the bank.

Note: UCO Bank reserves the right to change the aforementioned interest rates at its own discretion. All rates mentioned above are effective as of June 2016. Individuals looking to avail a loan from the bank are advised to check rates prevailing at the time of application.

Find more details about UCO Personal Loan Interest rates

items.title: How to calculate EMI on UCO Bank Personal Loans
items.body:
Knowning exactly what you EMI for the month is was never as easy as using the BankBazaar.com Personal Loan EMI Calculator. It will help you work out the exact pattern of your loan repayment.

All you need to do is fill in the input boxes that match the loan parameters, like the loan amount, personal loan interest rate, processing fees, and the tenure of the personal loan and click on Calculate.

Calculate your Loan EMI with UCO Personal Loan EMI Calculator

items.question: Can I check my UCO Bank Personal Loan status?
items.answer: If you have applied through for your UCO Bank Personal Loan then all you need to do is login and check your status in real-time. If not you can contact the UCO Bank at their business hours and provide them with the application number and the credential they require and wait for their update.

items.question: What will be my maximum EMI for a month?
items.answer: EMI for a salaried individual can't exceed 40% of his/her take home salary, for someone who is self-employed the value of the loan is determined by the profits earned.

items.question: Where can I apply for a UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: You can find the application for the loan at the branch.

items.question: Is there any processing charges for applying for the UCO Bank Personal Loan?
items.answer: There is a 1% charge the minimum of Rs. 750/-

items.question: What are the different kinds of personal loans offered by UCO Bank?
items.answer: UCO Bank offers many different personal loans depending upon the reason for which the borrower requires the funds. For instance, the UCO Shopper Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who require money to make purchases of household articles and consumer durables such as electronic gadgets, air conditioner, refrigerator, computer, television, etc. A top-up home loan can be availed by existing home loan customers to meet expenses related to children's education, furnishing, repairs and renovation of their home, agricultural purposes, business needs, etc. The UCO Car Loan Scheme can be availed by individuals who wish to purchase a motor vehicle. The UCO CA Loan Scheme is available to chartered accounts who require funds to construct / acquire office premises or finance cost of construction and land, finance cost of fixture, furniture and fittings of computers and other office equipment. The UCO Cash Scheme can be availed by individuals who require funds to meet unforeseen domestic expenses such as social obligations, education, marriage, etc.

items.question: What documents must I submit when applying for a personal loan from UCO Bank?
items.answer: The documentation process for a personal loan from UCO Bank is fairly simple, and the documents accepted by the bank include passports, driver's license, and Aadhar card for proof of identity. For proof of address, the documents accepted by the bank include telephone or electricity bills. Even a driver's license with a mention of the customer's current address is accepted. Payslips can be submitted as income proof.

items.question: What factors are taken into consideration by the bank when checking my eligibility for a personal loan?
items.answer: After you have submitted your loan application along with the necessary documents, the bank will run a verification check to ascertain your eligibility for the loan. Your job status, job security, monthly income, outstanding debt, credit score, ability to repay and a few other factors will be considered to ensure that you're a risk-free customer.

items.question: Can I avail a personal loan despite having a poor credit score?
items.answer: The bank will require you to have a good credit score before it sanctions any loan to you. However, you can take certain steps to increase your credit rating. Make sure that your ratio of secured loans to unsecured loans is good as the bank will consider you more responsible in this case. You must also make sure that you don't make loan applications with too many banks as it can reduce your credit score. Your job status also plays a crucial role. Make sure that you don't change jobs frequently as steady jobs and regular income are instrumental in the approval of a personal loan. The bank will only consider customers who have a steady job and are certain to draw an income that will help them clear their personal loan.

sections.title: SBI ELITE Credit Card

elements.body:
The State Bank of India offers the ELITE card for the people who travel frequently all over the country and the world. It is a travel and lifestyle credit card which offers a wide range of offers such as domestic and international lounge access, and discounts on an international and domestic flight and hotel bookings. Apart from this, the ELITE credit card has dining and entertainment offers as well.

Key Highlights of the SBI ELITE Credit Card Welcome Benefits
  • For every Rs.100 spent, earn 2 reward points.
Entertainment Benefits
  • Get free movie tickets worth Rs.6,000 every year.
  • This offer will be valid for a minimum of 2 tickets per booking per month.
Milestone Benefits
  • Earn up to 10,000 reward points on an annual expenditure of Rs.3 lakh and 4 lakhs.

    Add – Earn up to 15,000 reward points on annual spends.

Low Foreign Exchange Markup
  • The SBI ELITE credit card offers the lowest forex mark-up charge at 1.99% for international use.
Concierge Service

items.question: What is the joining fee I should pay at the time of card issuance?
items.answer: You will be required to pay Rs.4,999 as the initial fee.

items.question: How much is the membership fee per annum? Can I get it waived off?

items.question: Explain the fraud liability cover that comes with this card.
items.answer: Cardholders are offered a fraud liability cover worth Rs.1 lakh. You will be required to report the loss within 48 hours. You will need to visit the website of the bank or call the SBI credit card customer care helpline.

sections.title: Key Highlights of the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• As its name suggests, the Air India SBI Platinum Card has been designed to deliver premium benefits to frequent air travellers.
  • Travel bookings made on Air India are eligible for accelerated reward points.

sections.title: Travel benefits offered by the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• The card offers you a complimentary membership to the premium Air India Frequent Flyer Program - Flying Returns.
  • For every Rs.100 that you spend on booking air tickets on the Air India website, you earn up to 15 reward points.
  • It also offers complimentary access to lounges at domestic airports.

sections.title: Offers from BankBazaar on the Air India SBI Platinum Card

elements.body:
• You would love the paperless application process for the Air India SBI Platinum Card offered by BankBazaar.
  • You may check your credit score without paying anything for it on BankBazaar.

sections.title: Air India SBI Platinum Card Features and Benefits

elements.body:
Welcome rewards

  • You can bag a welcome gift of 5,000 SBI reward points while signing up for the card. The reward points will be credited within 15 days of joining/annual fee payment.
  • You also get free membership to the Air India Frequent Flyer Program – Flying Returns as a joining benefit.

Milestone Reward points

  • You can earn up to 15,000 bonus points on achieving milestone annual spends.
  • For annual spends of Rs.2 lakh, you earn 5,000 reward points and for spends above Rs.3 lakh, you earn 10,000 reward points. Thus, the cumulative bonus reward points earned is 15,000.

Renewal benefit: You earn 2,000 reward points every year when you pay the renewal fee for the card.

Reward points program

  • You earn 2 reward points on every Rs.100 spent on the card.
  • Every Rs.100 spent on Air India ticket booking (for self) will give you 15 reward points and 5 reward points (for others).
  • Reward points can be converted into Air India Air Miles which can be further redeemed for travel bookings made on Air India. 1 Reward point equals 1 Air India Air Mile.

Fuel surcharge waiver

  • You can avail 1% fuel surcharge waiver on all fuel transactions conducted using the card. The waiver is valid at all petrol pumps across India for transactions worth Rs.500 to Rs.4,000.
  • The maximum waiver that can be availed per billing cycle is Rs.250.

Complimentary lounge access:With the Visa Lounge Access Program, you enjoy 8 complimentary visits to select domestic airport lounges. You can also enjoy access to lounges at over 600 international airports with the complimentary Priority Pass Program

Balance transfer on EMI:You can transfer the outstanding balance on your other bank credit cards to the SBI card and pay it back in EMIs. The balance transfer on EMI offered by SBI comes at a lesser interest rate and processing fee.

Flexipay: The facility enables you to convert any big-ticket purchases made on the card into easy monthly instalments. Any purchase worth Rs.2,500 or above can be converted into EMIs and can be paid back in tenures ranging from 3 to 12 months.

Lost Card Liability Cover: You also enjoy a lost card liability coverage of Rs.1 lakh with the Air India SBI Platinum Card.

Railway tickets bookings: With the Air India SBI Platinum Card, you get the facility of booking railway tickets online and getting them delivered at your doorstep.

A. For converting the reward points on the Air India SBI Platinum Card to Air India Air Miles, call SBI Card helpline at 1860 180 1290 or 39020202. You require a minimum of 5,000 reward points for availing the redemption option.

The insurance cover includes lost baggage cover of Rs.1 lakh, delayed baggage cover worth Rs.25,000, lost or stolen passport cover worth Rs.50,000, loss of ticket cover worth Rs.25,000 and missed connection cover worth Rs.25,000.
  • Fuel surcharge waiver: You can free yourself from surcharge charged on petrol purchases at fuel stations across India with IndusInd Bank's surcharge waiver facility. The waiver is applicable on all the fuel transactions worth between Rs.400 and Rs.4,000.
  • Complimentary concierge services: Through 24x7 concierge services, the card provides a host of premium benefits such as pre-trip assistance, hotel reservation, flight booking, entertainment and sports booking, gift assistance, on-road repair service, emergency fuel supply, battery service, accident management, medical assistance, emergency towing assistance and others all with a single phone call. Cardholders can avail concierge services from anywhere in the world.
  • Zero liability on lost or stolen card: With 'Total Protect' program, IndusInd Bank provides complete protection against any unauthorised transactions that happen in case of loss or stolen card. The insurance covers up to 48 days prior to loss reporting.
  • Personal air accident insurance: Cardholders will get personal air accident cover worth Rs.25 lakh completely free with the card.

sections.title: How to apply for Jet Airways Voyage Visa Card from IndusInd Bank?

elements.body:
You can apply for Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card directly from IndusInd Bank's official website. Follow the instructions mentioned below to apply for the card online.

  • Visit www.indusind.com
  • From the menu choose Personal > I'm interested in > Cards > Credit Cards
  • You will be redirected to IndusInd Bank credit cards page on which you can find 'Jet Airways Voyage Visa Credit Card' by scrolling down
  • Click on the card name to find the features and benefits of the card in detail. You can also compare the card with other credit cards offered by the bank using the 'Add to Compare' option on the page
  • Once done, click on 'Apply Now' button to apply for the card
  • Enter required details such as your current location, date of birth, employment details and others and click on 'Submit'
  • Your interest to apply for the card is then submitted to the bank. Once the bank receives the application, it will approach you on your mobile or e-mail. It will initially check your eligibility to apply for the card and if found eligible will inform you about the next steps in the application process.
  • Alternatively, you can also apply through Bank Bazaar website. In BankBazaar homepage, visit the credit card section. You will have the option to explore all credit cards and also check the eligibility for each card. Once you have specified your requirements, BankBazaar's wizardry will make a list of card that suits your needs. You can select Apply and fill in your details to immediately apply for the card.

faq.title: FAQs Jet Airways IndusInd Voyage Visa Card:

items.question: Explain about the travel insurance that comes with Jet Airways Voyage Visa Card
items.answer: IndusInd Bank has tied up with ICICI Lombard to provide insurance cover against lost baggage, lost ticket, loss of passport and delayed baggage.

items.question: Do I get a fuel surcharge waiver when I use my card to make a fuel purchase?
items.answer: Yes. All cardholders are offered a fuel surcharge waiver of 1% for transactions above Rs.400 valid at any petrol station across India.

items.question: Tell me more about the Priority Pass travel program
items.answer: With priority pass travel program, cardholders can access over 600 airport lounges across the world. The membership fee for the program worth US$99 will be waived off. You just need to pay the usage fee to access any of the Priority Pass lounges located across the globe.

items.question: What should I do in the unfortunate event of loss or theft of my card?
items.answer: Contact the bank using the toll-free number or visit the nearest branch as soon as possible. Total Protect scheme will cover you against fraudulent transactions after you report the loss of the card.

items.question: Do I also have an air accident cover?
items.answer: Yes. All customers are offered a complimentary personal travel insurance cover of up to Rs.25 lakh.

sections.title: How To Apply For Airline Credit Cards Online?

elements.body:
Two channels through which one can apply for airline credit cards online include applying through bank's website and through authoritative third party platforms such as BankBazaar. Below instructions will help you know the online application process for airline credit cards.

Apply through bank's website: Many banks accept online application for airline credit cards. You can visit the bank's website and check for the availability of the feature. If you find 'Apply' button on the airline credit card page, you can follow the steps mentioned below to apply for the credit card.

    Steps to apply for airline credit cards online
  • Visit the official website of the bank
  • Choose an airline credit card that matches your requirement
  • Click on 'Apply' button to visit the online application page
  • On the application page, enter all the required information in the designated fields
  • Double check the entered information before submitting the application.

On successful submission of the application, the system will generate an application reference number, which should be recorded for all future references.

Once the bank receives the application, it reviews the same and if your profile becomes eligible for the applied card, you will receive a call in 3-4 working days. The further application process will be informed to you over a phone call or through an e-mail.

Banks typically take 7-10 days to process a credit card application. If you have any queries meanwhile, you can use the application reference number to track your credit card application status online.

Apply through BankBazaar website: BankBazaar is an authorised third party financial service provider. By partnering with more than 50 banks, the company offers a comprehensive platform to shop, compare and apply for financial products including credit cards, all under one umbrella. If you're confused about choosing a credit card, you can visit the website, go through the various credit cards listed on the site, choose the one that suits your needs and apply for it on the same platform. Mentioned below is the process to apply for an airline credit card through BankBazaar.

    Steps to apply for an airline credit card through BankBazaar
    • Go to bankbazaar.com
    • From the main menu, select 'Credit Cards'
    • The credit card page will display list of airline credit cards. You can choose one based on your travel needs
    • Beside the shortlisted card, you can find 'Check Eligibility' option. Click on the same and check your eligibility by providing the required details
    • If your profile is eligible for the chosen card, you will be taken to online application page, where you need to fill all the required details and click on 'Submit'
    • On successful submission of the application, the screen will display an 'Application ID', which should be retained for all future queries

BankBazaar also offers 'Track Application' feature through which you can check your credit card application status online.

sections.title: Eligibility For Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
Each credit card issuer sets a different eligibility criteria based on the card and applicant type. Mentioned below is the basic eligibility required to apply for an airline credit card.

  • Applicant should be an Indian citizen
  • Salaried or self-employed professional or self-employed business-holder
  • Should have a decent credit history (Not applicable for first time borrowers)
  • Minimum age of the applicant should be 21 years and maximum age is 60 years

sections.title: Benefits Of Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
For frequent travellers, having an airline credit card is like having a special privilege that provides various complimentary benefits throughout their trip. Exclusively designed for air travellers, airline credit cards come with many useful features and benefits including complimentary air miles, discounts at hotels, dining and others, free airport lounge visits, etc.

Let's have a look at the common benefits offered by airline credit cards.
  • Earn air miles: All the airline related transactions done using an airline credit card will earn air miles which can be redeemed for purchasing tickets on both domestic and international airlines.  
  • Bonus miles: It could be as a welcome gift or a renewal gift, credit card issuers typically offer bonus miles within a few days of card issuance. The miles can be encashed in the form of airline tickets during your next travel.
  • Accelerated miles: What's more fun than earning more reward points. With the accelerated miles programme, some credit cards offer accelerated miles on certain transactions. Make sure you're aware of the transactions eligible for accelerated rewards to make the most of the programme.
  • Airport lounge access: Sit back and relax in the airport lounges in times of delayed flights with the complimentary lounge visits offered by airline credit cards. The access is limited to select airports in India and in abroad. Cardholders need to display their credit cards at the eligible airport lounges and can enjoy the refreshments, internet facility and amenities offered by the lounges.
  • Fuel surcharge waiver: Of the other benefits offered by airline credit cards, fuel surcharge waiver is something useful even for less frequent travellers. Every time, you purchase fuel using an airline credit card, the fuel surcharge, which is typically charged on all card transactions at fuel stations, will be waived. Cardholders can thus enjoy fuel savings using an airline credit card.

sections.title: Documents Required To Apply For Airline Credit Cards

elements.body:
The required documents to apply for an airline credit card varies from one bank to another. Some basic documents required by many banks are mentioned below.

  • Copy of identity proof such as Aadhaar card, passport, etc.
  • Copy of PAN card
  • Two months salary slips or IT Returns
  • Copy of address proof document such as Voter's ID, Aadhaar, driving licence, electricity bill, passport, etc., whichever holds your current address
  • 1 passport size photograph
  • Duly signed in application

sections.title: What Kind Of Rewards Points Can Be Earned On Airline Credit Cards?

elements.body:
Airline credit cards are much helpful for those who travel often and are globetrotters. These cards besides providing regular credit card benefits provide exclusive features related to air travel. Complimentary lounge access to both domestic and international airports, priority check-in, extra baggage allowance and lot more.

Another interesting feature offered by airline credit cards is the reward points programme. Unlike the reward points programme on regular credit card, the reward points offered on airline credit cards will be accrued in the form of air miles. Each airline offer different air miles. For Instance, Jet Airways offers JPMiles, SpiceJet offers AirMiles, etc. The accrued air miles can be redeemed for flight bookings, to transfer seats from economy class to business class, and lot more.

Earning more air miles is also easy on airline credit cards as the card issuer offers accelerated rewards on specific spends that could help the cardholder to earn more air miles in less time.

sections.title: You may also like to read

elements.body:
Using credit cards to make your air travel economical

Many people dream of traveling by air but the high cost of flight tickets prevents them from fulfilling it.

To all such people credit cards can be a saviour. We are not saying using them would cut your flight expenses by half, but using them wisely would definitely reduce your expenses making your air travel economical.

Let us look at various ways to use your credit card to cut down your air travel expenses.

Choose right credit card: There are a variety of credit cards available in the market that would serve your specific needs. One such card is the Airline credit card which comes with a lot of benefits for those who fly often.

Credit card issuers compete hard to attract customers and to earn business by offering various sign-up bonuses. Choosing an Airline credit card that comes up with good sign-up bonuses would reward the customer with free air miles, discounted flight tickets and many more.

Accumulate more air miles: Just like how regular credit cards help you gain reward points every time you shop using a credit card, the Airline credit card offers the same benefit, but the reward points accumulated here are termed as air miles. The more you spend on your Airline credit card, the more air miles you accumulate.

Once you've gained enough miles, you can redeem them while booking your flight tickets or hotel rooms.

Sign up for frequent flyer memberships: Most airlines offer frequent flyer memberships, which would help the members to earn more air miles every time they fly. You can sign up for one or more airlines' frequent flyer membership programme, as it is completely free of cost, to avail the benefits. Some memberships allow you to earn miles on one airline and redeem them on any other airline. Hence, signing up for more than one membership will help you earn more air miles every time you fly.

Make use of airline promotions: Promotional offers by airlines are again a way to attract customers and to earn business in the most competitive airline space. You can take advantage of such promotional offers to make your air travel cheaper.

Some promotional programmes which offer air miles at affordable rates are the ones to grab as buying air miles at the original price is often expensive. Keep an eye on various promotional programmes offered by the airlines to make most out of it.

Earn from the airline partners: Airlines partner with other retailers such as food and beverage companies, apparels, hotels and many more. Knowing your airline partners and shopping from them will also bring you reward points. However, you need to be a member of the airline's frequent flyer programme to earn the rewards from its partners.

Now that you know how to make most of your credit card, get ready to fulfil your dream of flying high within your budget. Read more about

Premium credit cards offer the best of the lifestyle privileges and benefits that you can't expect from a regular card. A few high-end facilities offered by such cards are free lounge access to domestic and international airports and an exclusive reward points program.

Also, to redeem the reward points, these cards offer equally exciting redemption options across a diverse range of first-rate products and services. Another attraction of most of these cards is the set of special services by a dedicated concierge.
