sections.title: How to apply For The Premium Credit Cards?

elements.body:
You can apply for any of the credit cards listed here on the BankBazaar website. Not only this, you can even upload the necessary documents on the website and thus enjoy faster processing of your credit card application.

Other advantages of applying for credit cards on the BankBazaar website are the free chance that you get to check your credit score, the free chance that you get to check your eligibility for your desired cards, free gifts, etc.

Apply for the card on BankBazaar through the following steps:

  • Click on 'Check Eligibility' placed next to your desired card.
  • Verify your eligibility for that credit card by answering the questions asked.
  • Now you would be redirected to the particular bank's credit card application page where you would have to provide answers to the questions asked.
  • Click 'Submit' and then you would be prompted to upload your documents.
  • Upload them and click on 'Submit'.

On submitting the application and the documents, an Application ID would be shared with you. This ID should be used when you want to know your application's status. Just visit 'Track Application' and enter your ID.

sections.title: Differences Between Premium And Non-premium (Regular) Credit Cards

elements.body:
Premium credit cards are loaded with certain types of features and benefits which separate them from the regular credit cards. The premium benefits in these cards also mean that the fees and charges for some of them might be higher than those of the regular cards.

If you are wondering about how to distinguish a premium card from a non-premium one, the following section would help you in your attempt.

Fees and charges:

The associated fees and charges are generally higher for the premium cards as compared to those of the regular ones. These include the joining fee, the renewal (annual) fee, etc.

Eligibility criteria:

  • In addition to the other criteria, to be eligible for the premium credit cards, you need to have a relatively high annual income which is above Rs.50,000 for most such cards.
  • On the other hand, there are regular cards which have an income criterion of as low as Rs.12,000 per month.

Joining bonus:

  • Most premium cards offer attractive joining bonus offers like reward points in bulk, complimentary air tickets, air miles, etc.
  • The regular credit cards either don't offer any joining bonus and even if some of them do, it's not very rewarding.

Reward points:

  • One primary advantage of premium cards is the privilege of a highly beneficial reward points program. You can earn points by using the card on multiple lifestyle and other categories.

Also, the accelerated reward points program in these cards allow you to earn RP in bulk which can be redeemed for premium products and services.

  • Although the regular cards also offer regular reward points and (a few of them even have accelerated programs), these are not as attractive as the ones offered by the premium cards.

Here, the reward points earned are low and the redemption options are also moderate.

Concierge services:

  • Most premium cards offer the special services of a dedicated concierge who would take care of all your travel bookings, hotel reservations, entertainment booking arrangement, and other such handy services.
  • But you are unlikely to enjoy these services in a regular credit card.

Lounge access:

  • With premium cards, you get complimentary and paid access to international and domestic airport/railway lounges through international programs like the Priority Pass membership.
  • For the regular cards, even if they offer lounge access, the number of visits would be fewer than the ones offered by the primary cards. Also, it would only be for domestic lounges and not the international ones.

Golf programs:

  • If you want to enjoy free golf sessions and lessons at domestic and international golf courses, you need to opt for premium credit cards.
  • This facility is hardly offered by any of the regular credit cards.

Milestone bonus:

  • For premium cards, if the annual spends on the card cross a certain amount as specified by the issuer, you get a certain large number of reward points as a bonus.
  • Although the milestone bonus exists in regular cards too, the quantity of reward points is not that high.

sections.title: Axis Bank Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Salaried individual

  • The applicant must be at least 21 years of age, and the maximum age of eligibility being 70 years.
  • Net annual salary of Rs.2.4 lakh p.a.
  • The applicant must be employed for a minimum of 1 year.
  • The income eligibility criteria will depend on the Form 16 and the salary slip submitted.

Self-employed individuals

  • The minimum age of the applicant must be 18 years and the maximum age being 75 years.
  • The minimum net annual business must be Rs.18 lakh for selected car models, while for other models, the minimum net annual business income must be Rs.2 lakh.
  • The applicant must be employed for a minimum of 3 years.
  • The income eligibility criteria will depend on the latest income tax returns.

Self-employed non individuals

  • The minimum net annual business must be Rs.18 lakh for selected car models, while for other models, the minimum net annual business income must be Rs.2 lakh.
  • The applicant must be employed for a minimum of 3 years.
  • The applicant will have to furnish IT returns for at least 2 years along with the audited financials of 2 years along with the calculated income.

Priority customers

  • Customers with a vintage of 6 months.
  • The applicant must have an Average Quarterly Balance of Rs.1 lakh for the last 2 quarters.
  • The maximum loan amount that can be availed must be equivalent to 3 times the Average Quarterly Balance for the last 2 quarters.

sections.title: Factors affecting Axis Bank Car Loan eligibility

elements.body:
Some of the factors that affect Axis Bank Car Loan eligibility are given below:

  • Income: You will have to earn a minimum salary on a monthly basis in order to be eligible for the car loan scheme offered by Axis Bank. Higher your income, better are your chances of availing a car loan from Axis Bank.
  • Market fluctuation: Fluctuation in market also determines the interest rate that will be charged on your loan amount. The rate of interest may be higher if the inflation is high, and similarly can be lower if the inflation rate is lower. Hence, always check how the market is performing before availing a car loan.
  • Loan amount: The loan amount will determine the rate of interest levied. Higher the loan amount, higher will be the rate of interest.
  • Repayment tenure: The repayment tenure plays a role in the lender determining the rate of interest charged on the loan amount. Higher the repayment tenure, higher will be the interest rate charged and vice versa.
  • Income-to-debt ratio: The lender checks the income-to-debt ratio before deciding whether they should approve your car loan or not. The income-to-debt ratio is nothing but the ratio of your income to the debt you own. Hence, in order to avail a car loan at a lower interest rate, you must ensure that your income-to-debt ratio is low.
  • Relationship with your bank: Your relationship with the lender will also determine the rate of interest levied on the loan amount. It is always recommended that the applicant avails a car loan from the bank where he/she holds a bank account. The bank finds it easier to provide loan to a person who has been a customer of the bank for a very long time. Hence, there is a very good chance that the applicant will get a car loan at a lower interest rate.

sections.title: Car Loan Schemes offered by Axis Bank

elements.body:
The car loan schemes offered by Axis Bank are:

  • Axis Bank New Car Loan scheme: This scheme is suitable for those who wish to purchase a new car for themselves. The minimum loan amount that an individual can avail is Rs.1 lakh with the repayment tenure being up to 8 years.
  • Axis Bank Pre-Owned Car Loan scheme: Customers who wish to purchase a pre-owned car for themselves can avail this car loan from Axis Bank. The minimum loan amount that one can avail is Rs.1 lakh with the repayment tenure going up to 5 years.
  • Loan against car scheme: If you are in an urgent need of money, you can avail this scheme where you can offer your vehicle as a collateral in exchange for loan. The loan amount offered by the lender starts at Rs.10 lakh and up to 50% of the original value of the car.

sections.title: How to Calculate EMI on Axis Car Loan

elements.body:
Before you avail a car loan from Axis, you may want to know how much amount you will be paying towards the loan each month. This is simply known as EMIs or equated monthly instalments and it offers an easy way to repay your car loan. By calculating the Axis Bank Car Loan EMI , you will be able to budget your monthly expenses better.

You can calculate the EMI for your car loan by using the below-given formula:

E = P*r*[(1+r) ^n/((1+r) ^n-1)]

In the above formula, E denotes the EMI, P the principal amount, r the interest rate and n the number of years or tenure of the loan.

You can also calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator tool wherein you just need to enter the loan amount, interest rate, repayment tenure, processing fee, etc. The tool will calculate the EMI and display it to you.

items.question: Does Axis Bank allow part-payments?
items.answer: Yes, you can make a part-prepayment towards your car loan.

items.question: How to apply for an Axis Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A few channels through which you can apply for a car loan from Axis Bank are as follows:

  • Through the official website of the lender
  • Through a trusted third-party financial services website like BankBazaar
  • By directly visiting the nearest branch of the lender
  • It is easy to apply for a car loan online since you can complete the application process from anywhere and at any time. The process is completely secure, and your details will not be shared with other parties.

items.question: What is the maximum loan amount I can get with the help of an Axis Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: The maximum loan amount you can get from Axis Bank to buy a car will depend on your car loan eligibility criteria. The bank will also take into consideration the finance requirements, your income, and repayment capacity. A minimum of Rs.1 lakh and a maximum amount equal to 100% of the on-road price of the car can be availed.

items.question: Can I foreclose my car loan?
items.answer: Yes, you are allowed to pre-close your car loan. You can submit a request for foreclose at any Axis Bank loan centre.

items.question: Where can I get a car loan application form?
items.answer: The loan application form will be available at all branches of the lender. If you wish to apply for a car loan online, you will need to fill up and submit the online application form.

items.question: What is the process of loan verification?
items.answer:
After you have submitted your loan application and required documents, Axis Bank follows the procedure below:

  • Processing and approval of the application form
  • Verification of documentation
  • Sanctioning the loan
  • Disbursement of the loan

items.question: How long does the car loan process take?
items.answer: Axis Bank processes car loan applications in a timely manner, provided that you have submitted all the required documents. If the application form is incomplete or the documents needed for a proper appraisal have not been submitted by the customer, the lender may take longer to process the loan.

items.question: What security is acceptable to Axis Bank to get a car loan?
items.answer: In the case of Axis Bank car loan, the car will serve as security. You need to hypothecate the vehicle to the bank for the period of the loan. No other collateral is needed.

items.question: Do I need my credit score to apply for a car loan from Axis Bank?
items.answer: Since a car loan is a secured loan, your credit score might not be required. However, credit scores help get your loan approved and fetch you a good interest rate.

items.question: Can I cancel my loan application before it is sanctioned or disbursed?
items.answer: Yes, you are allowed to make a cancellation on your loan application. However, the bank may levy a penalty for the same.

sections.title: Factors Affecting HDFC Bank Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
The eligibility for availing a HDFC Bank car will depend on the below-given factors:

  • Income – If your income is on the higher side, there are good chances of your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan being higher. This is because a higher income indicates higher repayment capacity. To be eligible for HDFC Bank car loan, your yearly income should be at least Rs.3 lakh.
  • Loan amount – Your eligibility for a car loan from HDFC will be higher if you apply for a lower loan amount simply because if the loan amount is lower, the bank knows that the loan will be paid off quicker. Hence, they will be more confident to lend to you.
  • Repayment tenure - Choosing a longer repayment tenure can lower your eligibility for a car loan as it might give an impression to the bank that your ability to pay the loan is lower. This is because longer repayment tenure results in lower EMIs and the lender may tend to think that you cannot afford to pay higher EMIs. Therefore, the bank may be reluctant to lend to you.
  • Credit score – This is an important factor that most banks, including HDFC Bank, consider when determining your eligibility for a car loan. A credit score of 750 and above is considered a healthy credit score by most lenders. If you have a healthy credit score, banks will be happy to offer you a car loan and hence, your eligibility will be higher.
  • Relationship with the bank - As stated earlier, HDFC Bank offers instant car loans to their existing customers through the ZipDrive feature. This feature allows HDFC Bank customers to can avail loans instantly, at their convenience, with negligible documentation. This indicates that your relationship with the bank is an important factor while determining your eligibility.

sections.title: How to Increase Your Eligibility for HDFC Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
• Opt for a shorter tenure – When you choose a shorter repayment tenure, the EMI that you will be paying each month will be higher. This is an indication of your higher repayment capacity which will lead to banks feeling confident to lend to you. So, if you wish to boost your eligibility for a car loan, opt for a shorter repayment tenure.
  • Keep your credit score in check – If you wish to increase your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan, make sure that you maintain a credit score of over 750. You can use the Free Credit Score tool to check and maintain a healthy credit score. Checking your credit score regularly can let you take corrective measures to improve it if your score is low or give you confidence to approach the bank is it is high.
  • Maintain a low debt-to-income ratio – A low debt-to-income ratio means that you have a good balance between your earnings and spends. Before banks lend to you, they will check how much percentage of your earnings goes in paying your debts and a low debt-to-income ratio will be an indication of your high repayment capacity. To enhance your eligibility for a car loan, you should ensure that you maintain a low debt-to-income ratio.
  • Apply for a loan for a lower amount – By applying for a loan for a lower amount, you can increase your eligibility for HDFC Bank car loan. A lower loan amount means that the loan will be repaid sooner and hence, the chances of you being eligible for a loan is higher.

You can calculate the EMI for your car loan by using the below-given formula:

E = P*r*[(1+r) ^n/((1+r) ^n-1)]

In the above formula, E denotes the EMI, P the principal amount, r the interest rate and n the number of years or tenure of the loan.

You can also calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator tool wherein you just need to enter the loan amount, interest rate, repayment tenure, processing fee, etc. The tool will calculate the EMI and display it to you.

faq.title: FAQs on HDFC Bank Car Loan

items.question: What are the EMI options available on HDFC Bank car loan?
items.answer: Answer: HDFC Bank offers two EMI options – Step-up EMI and Balloon EMI. The step-up EMI option allows you to gradually increase the EMI amount over the loan tenure. On the other hand, the balloon EMI option lets you pay lower EMI amounts during the initial tenure and a higher lump sum amount at the end of the loan tenure.

items.question: Can I foreclose my HDFC Bank car loan and if yes, is there a penalty fee?
items.answer: Answer: Yes, you can foreclose your HDFC Bank car loan and you will not be charged any penalty fee for the same.

items.question: Can I get a top-up loan on my existing HDFC Bank car loan?
items.answer: Answer: You can get a top-up loan on your existing HDFC Bank car loan only if you are an existing customer of the bank. Existing customers need not provide any documentation for availing top-up loan on their car loans.

items.question: Do I need to provide a guarantor to avail a car loan from HDFC Bank?
items.answer: Answer: You need not provide any guarantor for availing HDFC Bank car loan if you meet the minimum income criteria. However, if you do not meet the income criteria, you may be asked to provide a guarantor or co-applicant.

items.question: Does HDFC Bank offer financing for all types of car models?
items.answer: Answer: There is no restriction on the type of car that can be financed by HDFC Bank car loan. Financing is offered for most of the passenger cars and multi-utility vehicles manufactured by top automobile makers in India.

elements.body:
The main features of the IndusInd Car Loan are mentioned below:

  • The online application process is simple.
  • The loan is processed fast.
  • The loan amount is disbursed quickly.
  • Car loans are provided for a wide range of vehicles.
  • Attractive interest rates are provided.
  • Flexible repayment tenure ranging from 12 months to 48 months for new cars and 12 months to 36 months for used cars.

sections.title: How to Calculate EMI on IndusInd Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
Some of the main factors that are considered when calculating the Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs) are the rate of interest, loan amount, and loan tenure. You can use the car loan EMI calculator provided by BankBazaar to calculate the EMI.

The process to use the calculator is very simple and only a few details will need to be entered. Once the details have been entered, you will be able to view your EMI.

sections.title: How to Apply for an IndusInd Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
The step-by-step procedure to apply for an IndusInd Bank Car Loan is mentioned below:

  • Visit the official website of IndusInd Bank.
  • Under the 'Personal' section, select 'Loan' and then click on 'Car Loan'.
  • On the next page, click on 'Apply Now'.
  • Next, you will have to enter various details such as your name, mobile number, email ID, the product that you are interested in, state, city, if you are an existing IndusInd Bank customer (Credit Card number or Customer ID will have to be entered if you are an existing customer), and captcha.
  • Once all the above-mentioned details have been entered, click on 'Apply'.
  • An IndusInd Bank representative will contact you to provide further details.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria of IndusInd Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
The car loan facility offered by IndusInd Bank can be availed by salaried employees and self-employed individuals (income and non-income based). The eligibility criteria that must be met for both the categories are mentioned below:

Salaried employees

  • You must be at least 21 years old at the time of applying
  • The maximum age of the applicant can be 60 years.
  • You must make an income of at least Rs.2,50,000 in a year.
  • You must have at least 3 years of work experience. At the time of applying for the car loan, you must have worked for at least 1 year in the current company.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.

Self-employed individuals (Income-based)

  • You must be between the ages of 21 years and 65 years.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.
  • Your CIBIL score should be more than 600 and you should not have a Caution or Negative profile.
  • You must make a minimum net profit of Rs.2,00,000 in a year.

Self-employed individuals (Non-Income based)

  • You must be between the ages of 21 years and 65 years.
  • Your CIBIL score should be more than 600 and you should not have a Caution or Negative profile.
  • You must have lived for at least 3 years in the current city and at least for 1 year in the current residence. You are eligible to avail a car loan if you are living in your own house.
  • Business ownership proof along with a minimum of 3 years of business stability must be provided.

sections.title: Documents

elements.body:
Depending on the category the applicant falls under, the documents that must be submitted will vary. The documents that must be submitted for the different categories are mentioned below:

Salaried employees

  • Income proof

Self-employed individuals (Income and Non-income based)

  • Passport-size photo
  • Identity proof
  • Address proof

  • Business proof

items.question: Should you provide collateral or security to avail the loan?
items.answer: No, you need not provide security or collateral in order to avail the loan.

items.question: Should you have an account with IndusInd Bank in order to avail a car loan?
items.answer: It is not mandatory for you to have an account with IndusInd Bank in order to avail a car loan.

items.question: Are there any special schemes provided in case you cannot submit the income documents?
items.answer: Yes, IndusInd Bank provides special schemes in case you are not able to furnish the income documents.

items.question: Is it possible for you to take a loan on an existing car?
items.answer: Yes, you will be able to take a loan on an existing car. However, the car must be hypothecated to IndusInd Bank once the loan sanction process is complete and before the loan amount is disbursed.

items.question: What is the method to repay the loan?
items.answer: You can repay the loan by providing post-dated cheques or via ECS.

elements.body: Magma Fincorp Limited is a Kolkata based non-banking financial company registered with the Reserve Bank of India as an Asset Finance Company. It was incorporated in 1988 and commenced operation in 1989. Magma possesses a diversified product portfolio: loans for cars and utility vehicles, commercial vehicles, construction equipment, tractors, used vehicles, SME businesses, mortgage finance as well as gold loan financing, housing finance and general insurance. They believe that no dream should go unfulfilled because of the lack of funds. Magma Fincorp provides loans for personal and commercial-use cars or utility vehicles, both new and used. Through BankBazaar, you can check your eligibility for a Magma car loan in seconds by filling in a short form. You can also apply for the loan online. All you have to do is to follow some simple steps to get attractive deals.

sections.title: Magma Fincorp Limited Overview

elements.body: Magma Fincorp Limited (MFL) is one of the leading non-banking financial companies based in Kolkata and registered with the Reserve Bank of India as an Asset Finance Company. It was incorporated in 1989 and is a RBI recognized Asset Finance Company. MFL has approximately 275 branches in India and also has a well-established presence in rural and semi-rural India. The company offers car loans, home loans, refinance, used vehicle loans, SME loans, commercial vehicle loans & more.

elements.prefix: Hit the road in a new set of wheels with our low-interest Car Loans. Get set, vroom!

sections.title: About Magma Car Loan

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides car loans to its customers to help them purchase a wide variety of passenger cars and multi-utility vehicles which are available through Indian car and utility-vehicle dealerships. The tenure for these loans range between 12 to 60 months. Salaried employees are offered the option of an 84-month repayment period. Magma Car Finance is offered with special privileges like personalized service and streamlined documentation that enables the customer to acquire the product faster.

sections.title: Why Choose Magma Car Loan?

elements.body: Magma Fincorp provides some unique benefits to its customers, like flexible repayment options, quick processing with least possible documentation and up to full value of the car is financed (under certain conditions as laid down by the company).

sections.title: Features & Benefits of Magma Car Loan

elements.body:
• Tractable documentation and fast processing.
  • Flexible loan repayment options monthly cash instalments, auto debit, ECS and post dated cheques.
  • The company offers excellent customer service as well as end-to-end doorstep service.
  • Easy loans are provided to existing Magma customers with good repayment records for 12 months or more, without them having to submit their income documents.
  • Attractive and incomparable interest rates.
  • Loans are offered for purchase of personal and commercial-use cars or utility vehicles.
  • Customers can receive funds up to 100% of the total price of the car.
  • Salaried professionals have the option to avail a loan which is up to three-times their annual salary and self-employed professionals can avail car loans up to six-times their annual income.

sections.title: Car Loan Schemes offered by Magma:

elements.body:
Tatkal Loan Scheme:

Under this scheme, for loans worth 60-65% of ex-showroom prices on any car for commercial or personal use, the customer just has to submit their KYC documents along with latest bank statement.

Magma Privilege Scheme:

This scheme can be availed by existing Magma customers with a consistently good record of repayment for last 12 months or more. They are eligible for new loans with 1.5-times higher EMIs than that of the current loan, without having to re-submit their income documents.

Agri Land-based Funding:

This scheme offers a loan of up to 80% of the ex-showroom price on a new vehicle, if the applicant has agricultural landholding which are between three to five acres.

No Income Proof Scheme:

An applicant can get a loan with their business and property proof documents for the last two years alone, under this scheme. The applicant can avail a loan of 75% of the ex-showroom price for a B-segment car, or 65% for a C-segment car.

sections.title: Magma Car Loan Eligibility

elements.body:
Magma offers car loans to salaried and self-employed applicants who meet the following eligibility criteria:

Salaried Customers:
  • Salaried customers should be employed under the same company/employer for a minimum period of two years.
  • The minimum age of the applicant should be at least 21 years when the car loan tenure commences and under 60 years or at retirement age, whichever is lower, when the car loan tenure concludes.
  • The annual salary of the applicant should be Rs.1,50,000 and above.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for at least one year.
Self Employed Individuals
  • The applicant should have been in the same business for a minimum period of two years.
  • He/she should meet the age criteria and be 21-years-old or above at the beginning of the loan tenure and under 67 years of age at the end of the loan tenure.
  • The applicant should have a minimum income of at least Rs. 1,00,000 annually.
  • The applicant must be residing in the same address for one year at least.

items.title: Documentation required for a Magma Car Loan
items.body:
Salaried

If the applicant is salaried she/he needs to submit the following documents:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Any one of the following documents:
    • Previous 2 years' Form 16 and payslip of the last month.
    • Proof of employment of being in the same organization for the past two years as well as last three months' payslips.
    • Salary certificate from the organization where the applicant is employed with corresponding proof of funds credited in their bank account.
Self-employed

Self-employed applicants need to submit:

  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • Previous 2 years' IT returns along with income computation.
  • 3 – 6 months' bank statement.
Applicants without income proof need to submit:
  • KYC documents such as proof of identity, address proof, signature, proof of DOB, etc.
  • Proof of business applicable for the last 2 years.
  • Residence stability proof showing that the applicant has stayed in the same address for a minimum of at least one year.
  • If applicant is an agriculturist, he/she has to submit proof of agricultural land holding.

items.title: Magma Car Loan Interest Rates and Charges:
items.body:
1. Interest rate

    Depending on various factors, Magma car loan interest rates vary from 12% to 16%.

  2. Foreclosure charges
    • Loan prepayment can be done with a 5% of the principal outstanding charged as prepayment fee after 6 months of availing the loan.
    • Foreclosures are not allowed within 6 months from date of availing the car loan. Lock in period charges have to be paid if foreclosures are made within 6 months, if it is allowed by the company under exceptional circumstances.
  3. Late payment penalty is 3% per month.
  4. Magma Car loan processing fees are as follows:
    • For loans up to Rs. 2.50 lacs, Rs. 3500 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • For loans ranging from Rs. 2.51 lacs to 5 lacs, Rs. 4050 is chargeable as processing fee.
    • Loans over and above Rs. 5 lacs is charged a processing fee of Rs. 4625.
    • On select schemes there is no processing fee.

items.title: How to calculate EMI for Magma Car Loans?
items.body:
BankBazaar.com offers smart and easy tools to calculate EMI. Customers can calculate EMI for Magma car loans by going to the BankBazaar home page and under the Finance Tools main menu choose EMI calculators. This EMI calculator can help customers to calculate monthly EMIs to be paid towards the Car Loan . BankBazaar's car loan EMI calculator is a reliable tool designed to quickly calculate the car loan EMI payment details. The step-by-step process to calculate their Magma car loan EMIs through BankBazaar.com is annotated below:

  1. Select the 'Finance Tools' drop down menu from the main page and select the EMI calculator option. Clicking on this link will lead you directly to the EMI calculator page.
  2. Scales are available on the EMI calculator page representing different ranges such as 'Loan Amount' and 'Tenure'. Mark the requisite details on the scales as per your requirements to help the tool calculate the EMI options available.
  3. After that, the customer has to enter details such as interest rate charged by Magma for car loans, along with the processing fee. The default value is already marked in the field and can be changed if required.
  4. Clicking on 'calculate' option will provide the customer with all the details related to the Magma car loan EMI payment along with the breakup of the total interest to be paid.

Check Magma Bank Car Loan EMI

items.question: What type of four wheelers can be purchased using Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase most multi-utility vehicles and passenger cars available at Indian utility - vehicles and car dealership. Magma Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase both new and used utility vehicles and cars.

items.question: What are the tenure options for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan customers can choose a suitable tenure option between 12 months to 60 months. Salaried customers can take up to 84 months to repay the car loan.

items.question: What are the types of Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Magma Bank offers 4 types of car loan schemes, each carefully crafted to suit varied requirements of customers. The types of Magma Bank Car Loan are as follows.

  • Tatkal car loan scheme
  • Magma Privilege Scheme
  • No Income Proof Scheme
  • Agri land based car loan

items.question: What is the maximum quantum offered under Magma Bank Car Loan schemes?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers financing up to 100% the value of car.

items.question: How long does Magma Bank take to process car loan applications?
items.answer: Magma Bank Car Loan applications will be processed in less than 4 hours, provided the customer has submitted all required documents and completed all formalities.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer loan for four wheelers intended for commercial use?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank Car Loan is also offered for new and used commercial vehicles.

items.question: What is the maximum car loan eligibility?
items.answer: Under Magma Bank Car Loan, salaried professionals can borrow up to three times their annual salary and self employed professionals can borrow up to six times their annual income.

items.question: What are the eligibility criteria that a salaried applicant must satisfy to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must satisfy the following conditions to be able to apply for a Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The annual income of the applicant must be at least Rs. 1, 50,000.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of car loan tenure and must be under 60 years or retirement age, whichever is lower, at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have been employed by the same employer for at least 2 years.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least a year.

items.question: I am a self-employed professional. What eligibility conditions do I have to fulfill to be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants must satisfy the eligibility criteria given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • The applicant must be earning a minimum of Rs. 1, 00,00 per year.
  • He must have been in the same business for a period of minimum 2 years.
  • The applicant must be at least 21 years old at the start of loan tenure and not more than 67 years at the end of tenure.
  • The applicant must have residential stability for at least 1 year.

items.question: What repayment options are available for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers an array of flexible repayment options like auto debit, ECS, Post dated cheques (PDCs) and monthly cash instalments for the customers to pay EMI.

items.question: How do I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Customers can apply online through Magma Bank web portal or visit the nearest physical branch to apply for a car loan.

items.question: Can customers apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, customers can apply online for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: Do I need a guarantor to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No, a guarantor is not required for Magma Bank Car Loan.

items.question: What is the tatkal loan scheme under Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: In tatkal loan scheme, car loans worth upto 70% of ex-showroom price on any four wheeler, MUV or SUV for personal or commercial use are offered to customers after they submit the KYC documents along with latest bank statement. This ensures that the car loan is processed swiftly.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. Can I apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, applicants with no income proof can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under "No income proof car loan scheme”. All the applicant has to submit is the property proof documents and income proof documents for the last two years to avail a loan of up to 65% of ex-showroom price for any C segment car and up to 75% the ex-showroom price for any B segment car.

items.question: What is agri based funding scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Under agri based funding scheme, applicants will be able to get up to 80% of the ex-showroom price of a new car if they have an agricultural land between 3 to 5 acres.

items.question: What is Magma Privilege scheme under Magma Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Magma Privilege scheme is a special car loan scheme for existing customers who have maintained a clear repayment records for the last 12 months or more. Such customers are eligible for fresh car loans with EMS at 1.5 times of current loan and they will be able to secure the loan without having to submit all documents again.

items.question: I am a salaried applicant. What documents do I have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
A salaried applicant must submit the following documents to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • KYC documents including address proof, identity proof, signature and date of birth proof.
  • Any one of the income documents - salary certificates with statements showing salary credit in bank account, payslip for last 3 months with proof of employment in concerned organization for two years and form 16 for last two years plus payslip for last month.

items.question: What documents do self-employed professionals have to submit for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Self employed applicants have to submit the following documents while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • One year residence stability proof
  • Bank statements for last three to six months
  • IT Returns for the last two years with income computation
  • KYC documents - identity proof, address proof, signature proof and Date of birth proof.

items.question: I have no income proof documents. What other documents do I have to submit while applying for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
If the applicant has no income proof, he must submit the documents given below to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan.

  • Proof of Agri land holding, if the applicant is an agriculturist
  • Business proof for last 2 years
  • KYC documents - Proof of address, ID proof, signature proof and Date of Birth proof

items.question: I have been in my current residence for only six months. Is it possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No. In order to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you have to submit proof for resident stability for at least one year. If you are residing at own or parental house, funding will be made available with residence stability of only six months.

items.question: I do not hold a Magma Bank account. Is it still possible for me to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: To apply for Magma Bank Car Loan, you will have to open a new Magma Bank account. But, you will not require recent transactions to apply for a car loan under Tatkal scheme.

items.question: Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan if there are no Magma branch offices in my area?
items.answer: Magma Bank offers car loans for customers living within a radius of 125 kilometres from any of the 280 plus offices across India.

items.question: For my loan payment structure, will I be required to select from post dated cheques or equated monthly instalments?
items.answer: No. Customers can take a car loan by submitting at least five security Post Dated Cheques (PDCs) and by making the payment of monthly instalments by direct deposit or cash at Magma Bank branches.

items.question: How do I find out my Magma Bank Car Loan EMI?
items.answer: You can find out your monthly EMI by using an online car loan EMI calculator available on BankBazaar. You will have to enter details like principal loan amount, interest rate and tenure in months to find out the EMI amount.

items.question: Does Magma Bank offer customer support services for car loan borrowers?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank car loan borrowers can get in touch with the bank by filling out a form online. After the form is submitted, a Magma Bank representative will contact you. Also, you can visit any of the nearest Magma Bank branches to get your queries answered.

items.question: I am an agriculturist. Will I be able to apply for Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, agriculturists can apply for Magma Bank Car Loan under the Agri Land based funding scheme.

items.question: Can I prepay Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, Magma Bank allows prepayments for car loans after 6 months of taking the loan.

items.question: Will I incur any penalty if I prepay my Magma Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: Yes, for prepayments, Magma Bank will charge a nominal penalty of 5% fee on the outstanding amount.

items.question: Can I use Magma Bank Car Loan to purchase a vehicle from foreign auto dealerships?
items.answer: No, Magma Bank Car Loan can be used only to purchase vehicle sold at Indian car dealerships.

sections.title: How to fetch the Lowest Interest Rates on Car Loans in Bangalore

elements.body:
Lenders in Bangalore offer attractive interest rates on car loans which may vary from lender to lender but did you know that you can negotiate with the lenders to offer you the lowest interest rates? That is right. Below we give you a list of things that you can do which will help you fetch the best interest rates on car loans.

  • Compare the benefits – Before you pick a particular lender to avail a car loan, ensure that you explore the benefits offered by various lenders on their car loans. Once you have done that, compare the benefits and pick a lender that offers the lowest interest rates. Many banks offer lower interest rates to its existing customers and hence, it is a good idea to check the interest rates offered on car loans by the bank where you hold an account. Some banks may also offer lower interest rates to new customers as part of a promotion and that is why, you should always shop around before picking a lender.
  • Choose a shorter repayment tenure – Many car loan applicants make the mistake of choosing longer repayment tenures as the EMI amount is lower on them. However, opting for a longer repayment tenure may prompt lenders to increase the interest rates on the car loan because it gives an impression of the applicant having a low repayment capacity. Therefore, if you wish to negotiate with your lender for a lower interest rate, choose a shorter repayment tenure.
  • Ensure that you have a good credit score – If you have a credit score of more than 750, your chances of securing a loan is higher. There are some lenders that will offer you a car loan even if your credit score is low but will charge a high interest rate. It is recommended that you check your credit scores regularly and for free on the BankBazaar website under the 'Free Credit Score' section. Once you know your credit score and if it is above 750, you can confidently approach and negotiate with the lenders to offer you a car loan at low interest rates.
  • Maintain a low debt-to-income ratio – Lenders consider the debt-to-income ratio of the applicant along with the employment status. Whether the applicant is salaried or self-employed, they should have a steady income and a low debt-to-income ratio to avail a car loan at a lower interest rate. The debt-to-income ratio is a measure of the percentage of the applicant's income spent on repayment of loans.

items.question: Can I sell my car before I finish repaying the entire loan?
items.answer: No, you will not be able to sell your vehicle before you have repaid your loan. To sell the vehicle, you will need to get a NOC (No-Objection Certificate) from the lender which the lender will provide only if you have foreclosed the loan.

items.question: Do I have to provide any collateral or security while availing a car loan?
items.answer: There is no collateral or security that you have to provide while availing a car loan as the lender will consider the vehicle itself as collateral.

items.question: How can I pay the EMI towards my car loan?
items.answer: The repayment towards your car loan can be made in three ways – Electronic Clearing Service (ECS), Standing Instruction (SI), and Post-Dated Cheques (PDCs). The first two ways of repayment are recommended as they are quicker and is less prone to errors as compared to the PDCs.

items.question: After I am done repaying my car loan, what is the process to remove the hypothecation from the Registration Certificate (RC)?
items.answer:
To remove the hypothecation from your vehicle after you have repaid the loan, you need to visit the Regional Transport Office (RTO) and submit the below-mentioned documents:

  • NOC from the RTO and your car insurance provider
  • Original Form 35
  • NOC issued by your car loan lender

You will also have to pay a fee for removing the hypothecation from your vehicle.

items.question: Can I cancel my car loan after it is sanctioned or disbursed?
items.answer: Yes, you can cancel your car loan after its approval or disbursal but a charge of Rs.1,000 will apply. In addition to this, you may also have to pay other charges such as stamp duty charges, interest accumulation, etc.

elements.body:
Flexible Repayment Tenure

Funding

  • For a used car: 60% of the value of the vehicle, as valued by the approved representative of the Bank

sections.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Dhanlaxmi Bank has set the MCLR at a benchmark rate which is effective from 7th May, 2016, for the Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan. New borrowers will be levied interest based on this system. Existing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations. The tenure based MCLR rate is as follows:

TenureRates of Interest Rate of Interest (%) p.a.
Overnight MCLR10.05%
2 days - 1 month10.05%
More than 1 month - 3 months10.05%
More than 3 months - 6 months10.35%
More than 6 months - 1 year10.45%
More than 1 year - 2 years MCLR10.50%
More than 2 years - 3 years MCLR10.80%
More than 3 years - 5 years MCLR11.00%
More than 5 years11.20%

The existing Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Base Rate = 11.40% per annum.

sections.title: Eligibility Criteria for a Car Loan from Dhanalakshmi Bank

elements.body:
Salaried employee:

Self-Employed / Professionals:

  • Should have documents proving that the applicant has a minimum annual income of Rs. 1,20,000/-

Private Limited Company and Public Limited Company:

  • Should be in the same business for a minimum of three years

sections.title: How to calculate EMI onDhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
It is a good idea to figure out the EMI before you sign your name on the cheque so you will have an idea of what exactly you are getting into. It also helps in choosing the best terms. It is easy to calculate the EMI using the car loan EMI calculator under the Finance Tools section in Bankbazaar.com.

First you should have at hand the following details: the loan amount, Rate of interest, proposed tenure and processing fee (if any).

  1. Go to Slider 1 to choose the Loan amount. Go to slider 2 to choose the tenure.
  2. In the following fields enter the interest rate and processing fee.
  3. Click on the "Calculate” button to get a detailed result which includes the EMI amount and Amortisation table. You can use these key details to make your decisions.

sections.title: Overview- YES BANK Car Loan

elements.body: When it comes to car loans, YES BANK has emerged as one of the preferred choice amongst people looking to purchase their ideal set of wheels. The bank's slogan 'Say YES to your BIG car dream' is in perfect sync with the Bank's popularity, its core value of providing comprehensive car loans that match the customers' taste as per the automobile of their choice, and its overall loan approval and dispersal machinery that is transparent and hassle free.

elements.prefix: Mr. Sharma was tired of taking a cab every day. We helped him get his own car.

elements.body:
Avail Car Loans from YES BANK

YES BANK car loans come attached with attractive interest rate, multiple repayment options with the tenure stretching from 1 to 7 years and the availability of loans for a wide segment of the Indian population. An assurance of speedy document processing and coverage of up to 90% of the car value (on select models), alongside a minimum and maximum loan amount of Rs.1 lakh and Rs.500 lakhs respectively, make car loans from YES BANK an ideal proposition for the serious buyer.

To apply for YES BANK's car loans, the following documents need be produced at the time of application (pre-approval stage):

  • Duly filled up car loan application form.
  • KYC Docs as per YES BANK policy.
  • Proof of Income.
  • Bank statement copies.
  • Signature proof verification.
  • Proforma invoice.
  • Passport size photographs.

The following documents must be produced post- approval/ pre-disbursement:

  • Loan agreement that is duly signed by the local RTO.
  • Post-dated cheques (PDCs) / ECS form / Standing instruction (SI) request with security PDCs as applicable.
  • Receipt of margin money.

Features of YES BANK Car Loan

The YES BANK car loan option is ripe with many customer friendly features. First up, it's available to a wide customer bracket- individuals, proprietorship firms, partnership firms and public or private limited companies. Next, for select models, the loan provides a coverage of up to 90% on the vehicle cost and seals the deal with some very competitive, attractive interest rates. The loan ensures a minimum pay-out of Rs.1 lakh, while the maximum amount could be Rs.500 lakhs. Also, multiple repayment options are available with the payback tenure ranging from 1 to 7 years.

Eligibility

The eligibility criteria to attain a YES BANK car loan rests on multiple factors, with the requirements differing for various target groups, as listed below-

For Salaried Individuals:
  • Minimum age to apply: 21 years
  • Maximum permissible age at loan maturity: 58 years
  • Minimum annual income: Rs.3 lakhs (3 months' salary slips/ Form 16 needed for confirmation)
  • Minimum work experience in current job: 1 year
Self Employed Individuals:
  • Minimum age to apply: 21 years.
  • Maximum permissible age at loan maturity: 65 years.
  • Minimum annual income: Rs.2 lakhs (2 years ITR/ Previous year ITR with adv. tax challan for current year showing higher tax paid than previous year, needed for confirmation).
  • Minimum experience in same business: 2 years.
Partnership Firms:
  • Minimum Annual Income: Rs.2 lakhs (2 years Audited Financials / ITR for last 2 years if audited financials not available are needed for confirmation).
  • Minimum experience in same business: 2 years.
Private Limited Company/ Ltd. Co.
  • Minimum Annual Income: Rs.2 lakhs (Last 2 years ITR & Audited Financial statement needed for confirmation).
  • Minimum experience in same business: 2 years

Compliance of the simple requirements listed above puts the applicant on the fast-track to a robust car loan from YES BANK, in turn leading to his/her cherished set of wheels.

sections.title: Factors to consider before applying for a car loan at Yes Bank

elements.body:
Purchasing a car is a big investment. Therefore, it is advisable to make an informed decision about your auto financing options. Here are some important factors that you should take into account when taking a car loan to purchase a car of your choice:

  • Rate of interest on car loan: The interest rate on a car loan depends on the loan amount, loan tenure, and the eligibility of the applicant. Yes Bank offers car loans at attractive interest rates depending on your eligibility and the loan amount and loan tenure that you choose.
  • Documentation for car loan application: To process car loan application, banks require identity, age, income, and address proofs from the applicant. Applying for a car loan is a simple process but the documentation process could be a hassle for customers. Which is why, lenders compete with each other to attract and retain customers by offering speedy documentation. Some banks offer minimal documentation for existing customers as they already have the KYC details of the applicant. Other than easy documentation, two other things to look out for in a car loan lender are fast processing and instant approval.
  • Car loan eligibility: Before applying for a car loan, check whether you meet the eligibility criteria set by the bank. Car loan eligibility criteria vary from lender to lender. Some banks have a free online car loan eligibility calculator on their website to help applicants calculate their car loan eligibility. Any salaried or self-employed applicant aged between 21 and 58 years with a good credit score, a stable occupation, and a steady income is eligible for a Yes Bank car loan. Credit score of an individual represents his or her creditworthiness while the income of a person represents his or her loan repayment capacity.
  • Car loan fees and charges: Banks levy service fees and charges on car loans such as processing fee, foreclosure fee, prepayment fee, stamp duty charges, late payment fee, etc. Processing fee is a small percentage of the principal amount that is deducted from the loan amount at the time of loan disbursal. Prepayment charge is a small percentage of the prepayment amount wherein the percentage varies depending on the time period during the loan tenure at which the loan is partly or wholly prepaid. Late payment charges are imposed on borrowers who fail to make EMI payments on the due date. The penalty fee for a late payment is a small percentage of the outstanding due of the loan amount. Foreclosure charge is a small percentage of the outstanding loan amount that a borrower decides to fully prepay before the end of the loan tenure.
  • Down payment: At Yes Bank, you can avail up to 90% of the car value. Therefore, for the remaining amount of the car price, you will have to make a down payment out of your pocket. Applicants without a good credit score or who don't meet the car loan eligibility criteria can obtain an auto loan by making a higher down payment on a car of their choice. Making a high down payment can reduce the cost of your car loan on the whole.
  • Car Loan EMI: Finding out how much your car loan will cost you on a monthly basis can help you choose an affordable loan amount and a suitable loan tenure. It is advisable to maintain a low debt-to-income ratio wherein the EMI does not exceed more than 50% of the borrower's income. A high debt-to-income ratio can lead to defaulting on your car loan. Use the free online car loan EMI calculator available on the bank website or a reliable third-party website to get instant and accurate results. Car loan parameters such as loan amount, loan tenure, and interest rate are required to calculate car loan EMI.

Yes Bank Car Loan Service Charges and Fees

ChargesAmount
Part prepayment ChargesPart prepayment is allowed only after 12 EMI payments. It can be done only twice during the loan tenure and only once a year. Part prepayment can't be more than 25% of the principal outstanding. 5% on the part prepayment amount within 13-24 months of first EMI. 3% on the part prepayment amount post 24 months of first EMI.
Loan reschedulement/rebooking ChargesRs.1,000
Loan cancellation ChargesCancellation can be done only before clearance of the first EMI. Rs.1,000
Stamp Duty ChargesAt Actual

Cheque Bounce ChargesRs.750 per bounce

Collateral ChargesRs.450 per case

items.answer: The rate of interest ranges from 10.75% to 13.50% per annum. Your rate of interest is determined on the basis of the car model. The interest rate can vary with changes to the base rate. Kindly check with Yes Bank for any revision in the rate of interest.

items.question: Are there any processing fees on Yes Bank Car Loans?
items.answer: Yes, there are non-refundable processing charges applicable. The processing charges are inclusive of GST and are listed below.

items.question: Can I foreclose my Yes Bank car loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can prepay the loan in full after 6 months from the date of taking the loan.

items.question: Can I make part payments on my Yes Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: No, part prepayments are not allowed. However, the bank may allow this at its sole discretion provided that the prepayment charges are paid.

items.answer: The foreclosure penalty charges are based on the loan tenure already completed. The loan tenure is calculated from the 1st EMI.

What Credit score is required for the Yes Bank car loan?
items.answer: When you apply for a car loan, the bank can enquire about your credit score. The acceptable credit score is 750 and above. Under certain conditions, the banks may accept scores as low as 550 points.

items.question: How do I repay my Yes Bank Car Loan?
items.answer:
Yes, Bank provides three methods of car loan repayment.

  • Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) - You can use the Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) which authorises Yes Bank to automatically debit your other bank account to make payments towards your loan.
  • Standing Instructions (SI) - If you maintain a bank account with Yes Bank, you can set standing instructions (SI). Yes Bank will debit the set amount from your bank account on the EMI due date.
  • Post dated cheques - You can also pay via post dated cheque where ECS and SI facility is not available.

The loan can be disbursed in the following ways:
